description:
I came across this place on yelp a while back, but never got around to trying it. This morning, I was a little early for work at the hospital, so I decided to stop for coffee before my 10 hour shift. 

Upon walking in, the aesthetically pleasing shop felt very welcoming and cozy. I was greeted by friendly staff, and they were quick to help me place my order. I was initially gonna go for a matcha latte, but as I looked over the tea latte list, I noticed more unique flavors such as jasmine, black mint, lavender earl gray, classic black, and honey coconut. I knew I had to try honey coconut because that sounded the most unique. I also have a sweet tooth so I figured something with the name "honey" would satisfy my sweet tooth.

I was able to place my order and get my drink within a very short period of time, and was able to make it to work just on time! I didn't get to try my drink until I got to work, but that first sip was AMAZING! The drink was not overly sweet and it wasn't overwhelmingly coconutty. It was the perfect balance of flavors. I'm kinda sad that my drink was diluted since all the ice melted by the time I was actually able to enjoy it. But other than that, the drink was fantastic. I will be back soon!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Really high quality and tasty drinks!  I ordered an iced lavender earl grey tea latte at half sweetness.  It wasn't too sweet and the tea flavor really stood out.  In a world where half of all cafes and boba places sell you sugar water, it was a relief finding this gem.  Prices aren't too bad - they're about $4 on average.  Service is good, baristas are friendly, and the drinks are high quality.

My only complaints are the limited seating if you're coming here to get some work done, and the wifi is on the slower side of things.  Other than that, I highly recommend a visit!
author: Tim L.

description:
This is based my first and only visit. It was a Friday morning around 9am. I'm not normally in this area during the weekdays, but I was in the neighborhood for some business. 

The menu is simple, but enticing. I ordered the Honey Coconut Tea Latte and I loveddddd it. I also noticed they have Oatly oat milk. Score-- because not many cafes have it. Staff is friendly, the place has a lot of foot traffic... I liked the simple, clean  space. Lots of wood. Cute!
author: Lani S.

description:
I was nearby running errands and stopped by for a latte and a pastry. I think this is now my favorite little coffee shop. 

I ordered a cheese and chive scone with a matcha latte. The matcha flavor was just the right amount of bitterness and not too sweet. The scone was very cheesy and texturally pleasing. 

The coffee shop is small (about 15-20 seats inside) but it's a nice place to get work done or meet with a friend. 

Good coffee and great atmosphere will definitely have me coming back for more.
author: Rachel M.

description: Simple but good Boba in the middle of Geary. Great pick for the SF Boba Meet up group. I am very picky with Boba and this place has true quality boba . I got the peach purée with tapioca. It was so yummy and gummy . This place space is small but packs a big punch with their drinks whether is matcha or lavender earl tea. I take mines to go unless you find a chair or table.
author: Juan V.

description:
Lavender earl gray tea latte-unique and combines two of my favorite things, so I guess I'm biased. It was too sweet for me though, so if I ordered again I'd ask to modify it if possible. 4/5

Limited seating; we had to cram at the bar and wait for a table to open to work, so maybe not the most ideal location for working. Wifi is also a touch slow. 3/5

Very cool bathroom. 5/5
author: Kimberlee G.

description:
Their restroom is out of this world. Maybe that doesn't seem like priority but hear me out. They've got a futuristic set up in back that you should know about. Patrons let the staff know they need to use the loo and someone will print out a paper with a code that is scanned to open up the door to the bathroom. You step in and the door closes behind you. No touching. Do your business, then flush by waving your hand at the self flusher. The faucet is motion censored so wave your hands around after you've got them sudsy to rinse. Wave hands adjacent to where you just were and dry them. Walk to the door and wave again, open sesame.

Ok where were we? I've had their soy latte (with espresso) as well as the soy latte (tea). The espresso was strong, aromatic, and powerful. The tea was a bit weaker in terms of flavor and came sweetened. For all drinks there is the option of adding boba. The food selection was limited, namely pastries like croissants or donuts.

More seating would be ideal. There's an area to perch by the window (narrow high table, stools) and a few tables in the back that will sit at most 2 people per table. Depending on how busy it is, you may not be able to reliably get a spot. Free wifi. The staff was friendly and helpful.
author: Cici T.

description:
Their loo evokes the feeling of being in a foreign country. One literally doesn't need to touch anything; everything from the door opening to the flush to the hand washing and drying is motion-detected. 

Old-school style spin-around chairs and desks. 

Kid-sizes hot chocolates are $2.50 and are super yummy (not overly sweet).

Donuts only on weekends.

(Would be five stars if not for a rather messy plastic trash bin in the center of the room )
author: Camille L.

description: Fifty/Fifty has very high quality drinks but a limited menu. I have tried the lavender earl grey (which was creamy and had a very strong hint of lavender) as well as the peach purée tea (which wasn't too sweet which I loved). The majority of the drinks were 4.00-4.50 (except the loose leaf tea which was only about 2.50) and I didn't have the opportunity to try the baked goods but they all looked extremely scrumptious. The place itself is very clean and modern, but the venue is small so seating is limited. (if you're looking for a place to study, this probably isn't the place for you unless you go early) I hadn't had the time to check out their infamous bathroom, but if I ever go again, I will definitely be on the lookout. overall, it was a solid experience but nothing too out-of-this-world which was why I only gave it 3 stars
author: Maya S.

description:
This is probably my new favorite coffee shop in the area. The interior is bright, minimalist, and clean. There's not much seating, but I was able to grab a table on Saturday morning and settle down with a hot Lavender Earl Grey tea latte and a warm cheddar scone. The tea was lovely and I really enjoyed the strong flavor of lavender. The scone tasted great. It was soft and easy to pull apart; more like a fluffy cheese pastry. 

Definitely going to be returning on weekend mornings when I get the chance! They have WiFi and conveniently placed wall outlets too, so it's a good place to do some work.
author: Ellen L.

description:
Simple and clean neighborhood coffee shop. Loved the minimalist look and approach. The lavender and earl grey latte was very fragrant and also delicious. Was a bit bummed that my friends and I didn't get latte art, that's what really got me in the door initially. Also, their latte is super super hot so be careful. 

Lastly, service was okay, didn't feel overly welcomed in the shop but maybe because I came with a group & mostly everyone inside was alone and on their phone or laptop. 

Definitely worth trying if you're in the area.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
This is my favorite coffee shop in the city. The mocha was impeccable, and the ham and Swiss croissant is perfect. 

I actually don't think I've ever had a better ham and Swiss croissant. The croissant is so flaky that even an extremely neat eater like myself inevitably ends up with a mess of flakes on top of whatever plate happens to be unfortunate enough to sit under my beak. 

What really made this five stars was not just the awesome croissants, but the pour over was absolutely fantastic. I added cream and sugar because I was in the mood for a sweeter coffee on a Sunday morning, but I really didn't have to. The pour over was a nice blend of earthy and chocolatey elements. 

Highly recommended to try this out if you like fancier, Seattle/Portland style coffee shops where making good coffee is considered an art. Enjoy!
author: Enrique C.

description:
I'm very picky with coffee and tea. This place I would highly recommend. You get the trendy feel from here. They also pour their drinks very generously. 

The place is a little small. But they have free wifi so you can definitely bring your laptop to study here.
author: Makaela M.

description:
Nice place except I'm not a fan of Ritual Coffee. Coffee & tea drinks, limited pastries selection, and tapioca after 12pm is about all that is offered here. Being right on the Geary Blvd thoroughfare, it can get a little loud with the 38 running through and the constant fleet of delivery trucks. 

Staff was very nice and the 100% touchless bathroom is pretty cool (you still gotta use your hands for the business part though). Not a whole lotta seating either. Parking is better than being deeper into the avenues.
author: Dan F.

description: Super cute and also super small! Not a lot of seating options, so snag a table if you can. I got the cold brew and the mushroom and gruyere cheese danish. I wish that they would have heated up the danish first, but it wasn't terrible to eat cold. Cold brew was fine, but I've definitely had better.
author: Tracy T.

description: Not sure why this place is so highly rated. I've had their latte and boba milk tea and both were o-kay, but not worth the price. Plus, half the time I've gone with friends, they are out of boba! I think it has to be the aesthetics of the interior and the location to USF are what make this place popular.
author: Erica C.

description:
I came on a Thursday morning to try the Earl Grey Lavender drink. I wanted to get boba but they don't make it until 12PM. The girl who greeted me was a bit unfriendly and seemed hostile - but I let it go since it was like 7:30 AM. I ordered my the drink and got it togo and iced, the total was $4. My first impressions was that the lavender and overall earl grey flavors were really strong! It tasted good and was a great pick me up to a Friday Jr Morning. I came here expecting to see the doughnuts that everyone was talking about but didn't see them in the display case - so that was a bummer. The atmosphere is clean, minimalist and has plenty of natural lighting - it reminds me of boba guys! I was able to bring my sketch book and just draw for a couple minutes before catching the bus. Overall, the drink was good, a fair price, and I definitely want to come back to try the boba! 

They have these super cute stamp cards that look like business cards so don't forget to grab one.
author: Anna L.

description:
I really enjoyed myself at this tiny cute coffee shop tucked at the corner or Geary street, where you could order a small cup of tea latte, have a sip, and kick off a bright new day. They offer a rather large tea selections to choose from, honey coconut, black mint, or my favorite option, lavender earl grey. Tapioca is only available in the PM.

Didn't try myself, yet they proudly serve coffee beans from Ritual, my favorite chain in the Bay Area. Also their daily freshly baked goodies looked very tempting, need to grab a bite!

Very cosy!
author: Elaine H.

description:
Found some quality drinks over at this cute & hip cafe. 

It's a very subtle, clean cafe that sits on the corner & sort of blends in, but you'll find it. & PARKING was not that difficult to find! 

It's not a huge cafe, pretty small with a decent amount of seating. My friends & I ordered a Lavender Earl Grey Latte, Matcha Latte, & a Black Mint Latte (all iced).

The Earl Grey & Black Mint lattes were particularly delicious & I would definitely recommend these two. The Lavender Earl Grey tastes just as it sounds, & the Black Mint is basically black milk tea with mint leaves--surprisingly very good! 

Very nice pick me ups to start your day :)
author: Monet M.

description:
This is an edit for my prior comment. 
The new two girls were lovely! I will again start going here! 

My older comment 

Very good coffee and well made. I want to come here everyday, but one of the girl who works here has a weird attitude like she hates her job. She makes very good coffee though.
author: Angelina P.

description:
This tiny little coffee shop is located right on the corner of the street. The cafe itself is pretty tiny with only 3 tiny tables and about 4-5 bar seats right at the window. There were a few people here studying, but for the most part people were standing in line and just getting drinks to-go. It seemed like getting various tea drinks was the popular thing to do. 

For some reason, I remembered seeing people recommend getting a hazelnut latte here so that's what I ended up trying. Unfortunately, she said that it was made with some hazelnut syrup but I ended up going for it anyway just to try it. I made a very bad decision in sticking with trying this hazelnut latte because it tasted very artificial. The syrup tasted like it was old and had been sitting there for a long time and completely ruined the latte. I barely drank half of it and ended up trashing it unfortunately. I hope their other drinks taste better.
author: Catherine S.

description: I'm the kind of person who wants my coffee to taste like dessert. I'm usually not a fan of black coffee, and I like to use tons of cream and sweetener. When I order lattes from Starbucks, I usually need to add two packets of Splenda. Fifty/Fifty's lattes are so good I don't even doctor them at all! They must use great beans and have excellent barista skills because their coffee tastes great on its own.
author: Traci R.

description:
This is a really cute place, I'm so glad I got to try it last week.

I had the hot coconut honey tea latte. It was really tasty, but a little too sweet for me. Next time I'll definitely ask to cut the sugar down by at least 50%. Also, I really want to try the lavender early grey latte because of all the reviews about it.

The only down side to this place is that there isn't very much seating. I was meeting up with someone for coffee around 330 on a Friday and I managed to get a small bench that I believe is only meant to be temporary seating because the bathroom door kept hitting my seat.
author: Gita r.

description: I been here twice for water first time i got a decent plastic cup with iced water i go a second time to get more water and they mug me and was rude about giving me some damn water. I hate these trashy coffee shops never again just for water bro
author: Sophia T.

description: Really cute coffee shop! Has a variety of teas, pastries, and coffee! Favorite has to be the matcha lattes!
author: Blair W.

description:
I was impressed this place was so clean. It's very cute and they pack a lot of seating in such a small space. 

You can get bubble tea with soy milk. I'm always on the hunt for non-dairy bubble tea with no lines.  

They have coffee and puree fruit drinks too.  Their pastries looked fresh and like they were from a real bakery. 

I got the lavender earl grey tea latte with tapioca. With the tapioca and soy milk add-ons, it came to $5. Yum yum. The pearls were slightly sweet like they were flavored with honey or something. That was the best part of the tea. I will definitely come back here.
author: Mitch C.

description: This is a very cute and urban cafe. The coconut latte was very delicious! I would go back just for that. The service was fast and the barista was very friendly. The little art they make with the foam is a beautiful touch to make your drink look fancy. The place isn't very big but has some seats and tables.
author: Pa H.

description:
Nice, clean modern space. Service was super nice and quick. It's a great place to read or get some work done as there's a lot of natural light.

I got the lavender earl grey latte with boba ($4.50). The boba texture was perfect. The tea was good and I could tell it was high quality but I wasn't a huge fan of the flavor. That's just my personal taste and I would love to try their other flavors!
author: Linda X.

description: The room was warm. The mocha was tepid. The service was cold. The price burned a whole in my pocket. I would forgive the drink not being hot enough and the prices being high if only I had been served with a little warmth. I feel like the only words spoken to me were "Mocha!" when my order was ready. Won't be back.
author: Charles S.

description:
Food:
- Croissant: fresh and airy, crisp the way it should be, even at 4pm after almost a day of sitting. (I was told they were prepared freshly every morning, which I certainly believe.)
- Latte: small, but delicious. Creamy, but not too much. Really a rather good latte. Superb for dunking cookies (to be mentioned beneath). 
- Toffee / Chocolate Chip cookie: fucking unreal. Strong recommendation. It's a large cookie, but it manages to be light and not overly satiating. Texture and flavor are both on point, and it occupies that sweet spot where it's soft to eat, but not so crumbly as to dissolve in your aforementioned latte.

Vibes:
- Great chairs for sitting with a laptop. 
- Nice music, pretty subdued. 
- It's generally a pleasant/mellow environment. Seems like a nice spot to spend time.
author: John L.

description: Stop by to wait for Dinner reservation.  Nice niche. Clean & good customer service.  Yes they have a card if u are nearby and a frequent customer it's worth getting. Warm day and wanted something cold. I had the mango tea purée.  Cold and good. Wanted to taste more Mango . $4.00 cheap. Prices for coffee and tea is reasonable.  If I'm in the neighborhood; it a place I'll stop by for coffee/tea or something cold to relax.
author: Carmen O.

description:
This spot which once used to be my best kept secret is now being discovered by many SF locals! Fifty/fifty is a very small cafe that's great for on-the-go drinks because of its limited seating and lounging area. I have seen there be a line in the mornings, but usually later in the afternoon there's no wait at all. The prices for coffee and tea range from $3-$5. My favorites here are their iced tea lattes with pearls; I would say they're on par with the quality almost as good as Boba guys! Definitely recommend the lavender earl gray & honey coconut for trying something completely new (also, I don't think I've seen these flavors offered at any other boba shop either). Pearls are served after 12pm for .50 extra. Get pearls if your heart desires, as they make it to have really good consistency and texture. Free wifi here too! Great for a quick study session or being here for about a couple hours. This is probably the only cafe that comes to mind when you're craving boba instead of coffee and need to be in an environment to get work done.

In terms of food, they have a limited selection of pastries. I haven't tried any of them but knowing how great their drinks taste, I'm sure their food is as delicious!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Not really a cafe/coffee person but a friend and I met here to chat and now I can see why people enjoy cafes. 

Loveee their honey coconut latte iced...w boba, it's amazing. Better than boba guys! 

The downfall to this place though is that it's quite small and not enough seating/outlets if you want to get some work done.
author: Carmen L.

description:
Yay for lavender! I got a lavender cappuccino and it was awesome. The workers were super friendly too.

Next visit: got the iced green tea with mango puree and it was SO GOOD. Not too sweet, very refreshing. I think this is my new favorite spot.
author: Kelly G.

description: I often frown on yelp users that use this as a means to rate service versus the food/beverages. However, I have been a frequent customer at this location and while I have enjoyed the majority of their beverages, today at 3:30 the cashier/barista reminded me of why I prefer places such as ritual, samovar, sightglass- where the ambience, coffee, and staff are pleasant. I was going to use the stars I earned on my cards and instead gave them back to her because I will probably never go back to this shop again. Truly disappointed. There goes a once loyal customer.
author: Carina D.

description:
I have to say, I got a great looking, pretty, Macchiato in a small glass there.  I was surprised to see the tiny flower/'latte' art atop the 1.5" glass. 
Great job, gals!

I hope I got the commas right above.., too.

p.s. yay strong Ritual Coffee.
author: Jordan G.

description: Literally come out of my way for their jasmine tea latte! Their selection is amazing and the ambiance is really relaxing to work in. I give this place 5stara for being a good local spot to go too.
author: Kafilat Y.

description:
This tiny coffee shop is right across the street from a bus stop, so it's fun to sit at the counter by the window to people-watch and watch cars drive by. (I feel like this makes me sound like a weirdo considering my last review haha). It seems like a popular place for students to get work done because there is almost always one or two people slaving away at their computers in there.

Decent offerings, though it's kind of a limited menu, and they have a variety of pastries in the window that look a few days old. I ordered a matcha milk tea with boba, and the boba was tasty, but otherwise, it was a bit overpriced for what it was.
author: Alice L.

description: 5 stars for the Good2Go bathroom. So cool. Oh, also great drinks and donuts. Though the internet sometimes crawls. Upgrade the speed please!
author: Timothy S.

description: This was a decent spot to pop into for a late afternoon coffee.  My mother in law and I enjoyed our Americanos, and my husband and father in law really liked their pour overs.  They have a decent amount of seating, and it was a warm, comfortable setting.  The staff is friendly.
author: Barnali D.

description: Great cafe to get work done in--there are several small tables that feel like personal desks. Excellent choice of speciality lattes and well crafted coffee. Nice staff.
author: Dana C.

description: Went in for a quick sweet something. Got the toffee, chocolate, something cookie very good, not extraordinary. Kinda pricey. Terrific counter customer care.  Packed at 5:15pm
author: M M.

description:
Although I think their earl grey/lavender latte has a great flavor, I would absolutely not recommend getting the chai latte unless you want to over-pay someone to steam your milk and add a dash of cinnamon. The chai flavor here is missing and is entirely disappointing from a place that prides themselves in tea-lattes!

They have a stamp loyalty card. Kinda lame that they don't let you combine stamp cards

Nice and prompt service
author: Jeanie N.

description:
Simple coffee and tea shop that focuses on quality and splurges on the details. Best hot tea (with kettle for your pouring delight) in recent memory. It tastes so pure and refreshing that it calmed me down from a hectic day. And a fresh baked dynamo (bacon topped) doughnut got my sugar levels rising.

Come here for a quiet escape from the busy world and focus, like fifty/fifty does, on the simple things done right.
author: Regina D.

description:
I've been coming here since I began school at USF nearly 4 yrs ago. The coffee shop is as old as I've been going to school, so I'll be sad to part ways when I graduate! Lol

Fifty/Fifty is the perfect addition to the Inner Richmond/USF area, and I feel like the owners knew this neighborhood needed a coffee shop like this one. The environment is clean, simple, and minimal without being too tryhard or cookie cutter hipster. The music is never too loud and store is generally quiet, which makes this place SO AMAZING to study and do my readings. You can tell the two owners put a lot of love and care into this place!

My favorite drinks are the jasmine and matcha iced lattes with boba. Their coffees are usually quite good, but I noticed that they're less strong. I'm not sure why - I don't know a lot about coffee, but that doesn't affect my 5 star review because of everything else! Pastries are good too, but I believe they no longer serve Mr. Holmes Bakehouse :-(

I've seen and heard a lot of people complain about the baristas being unfriendly and I honestly feel the opposite! They're always willing to fix drinks or mistakes, and the owners are always so warm to their regulars. Some servers don't talk at all and don't always smile, but you're not paying for them to smile and commodify their emotions... right?

This place can get pretty busy, and the shop is on the smaller side. If you're 1 person occupying an entire table, be nice and offer someone a seat!! :p
author: Jacquelyn T.

description:
One of my favorite coffee/tea shops in SF hands down. 

The space is small, but there is seating. If you want a seat, you'll have to be strategic about it though since there isn't much, but this is mostly expected in small coffee shops in SF. The look and feel of the shop is white, minimalist, clean and simple. The large window in the front of the store also provides a nice open feel to it as well. 

I've tried a variety of different drinks here: vanilla latte, matcha latte, mango iced tea, peach iced tea, and mixed berry iced tea. I absolutely love their drinks. I tend to like my drinks a little on the stronger side and less sweet and this place does exactly that. Their fruity iced teas are really refreshing and has a strong tea taste that doesn't get lost with too much sweetness. They also use fruit puree which is very nice as it tastes and feels less artificial and probably why it isn't as sweet. They also have boba that you can add to your drink too! Which is a plus for me! I have not tried their pastries or other drinks, but from what I have had, I am very pleased.
author: Christina C.

description:
If you didn't know fifty fifty was there you might walk straight past. But you'd be missing out. 
Coffee was smooth and creamy. Their lattes did not disappoint.
author: Jack B.

description:
I stop by this little coffee shop at least once a week on my way to work for a matcha latte or Jasmine tea latte. The best. Staff is quick, the space is small but clean and minimal, and their lattes never disappoint. They're not cheap, but comparable to any other coffee shop in SF. They even have boba(!) after noon that you can add to any drink, which I have yet to try since I'm only here in the mornings. One of these weekends I'll definitely try it with an iced drink. 

Tip: start a stamp card for a free drink after your 10th!
author: Stephanie G.

description: I was taking a walk during my lunch break and came across this little shop. It was a warm day and I was feeling something light and refreshing, so I decided to go with the peach tea purée drink. OMG.... I truly wasn't expecting something to taste as good as it did. I'm not a fan of very sweet drinks, so I decided to go with 25% sweetness and it was just right. The flavor was just impeccable. I definitely will be coming back here to try some of their other drinks and possibly the pastries behind the glass casing.
author: Julia K.

description: Gone down the drain. Empty and took 7 minutes to get a latte. Not friendly and very expensive.  Go some place else. I used to love this spot now it's on my never try again lists..
author: Moni K.

description:
Great neighborhood coffee shop - very clean, lots of wood accents, and drinks in mason jars. The brief, idiot-proof menu is printed on the wall and there is a small selection of pastries in the display case. I'm not a huge doughnut lover, but I was pleased to see that they serve Dynamo doughnuts. 
Mr. Joy and I stopped by for a green tea latte with tapioca. It was refreshing and sweet. 
There are also a few small tables along the wall and some seats by the window. It does look like some people bring their laptops and camp out here for a workspace option.
author: Joy W.

description: Usually I'm more of a coffee drinker, but I love lavender and I love early grey, so I tried the lavender earl grey tea latte since I saw it all over yelp and it did not disappoint! It was a little sweet for my liking, but still really good. The cafe itself is pretty small - 4ish tables inside and a bar facing the window. Would come back if I'm in the area.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Lukewarm cappuccinos and lukewarm customer service - staff. Their cappuccinos had nice flavor but weren't hot at all. That's bad enough but the staff can't say ' thank you ' or even smile. It seemed like they're working community service.
author: L D.

description: My friend and I stopped by around 11:45 am, so boba wasn't available yet. (This was fine by me because I'm not a fan, but it's good to know if you are looking for your boba fix - stop by after 12 pm!) I ordered an iced honey coconut tea. It was delicious! Not too sweet and the price was right at $4 (plus tip). There isn't a lot of seating, but it is a cute spot that I'll definitely be visiting again soon!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I'd been wanting to try this coffee shop for quite a while.  The vibe was not what I expected inside.  It felt kind of starbucksy.

The star of the show here were the pastries rather than the coffee.
author: Joseph B.

description:
This is my favorite coffee shop west of Divisadero. 

Good coffee (and tea), friendly staff, stable wifi, power outlet, clean bathroom, and nice interior. I can spend all day here. (and I did many times)

The only downside is it's pretty small. So you won't always get a seat. It's a 5-star regardless.
author: Joseph L.

description: Loved this little coffee/tea shop! Very simple and clean layout. Its small but had a few table inside and outside, plus a small sitting area at the window so you can look out to Geary and people watch. I tried their lavender grey latte with soy milk.  It was delicious, the perfect amount of floral lavender and earl grey. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Angela D.

description:
Finally a half decent cafe in this area full of mundane cafes. The setup is clean and simple. The desserts items I tried were OK nothing special. 
Here is the verdict on the cappuccino
Espresso: Medium
Crema': Good
Milk: Frothed Well
Latte Art: Good
3 stars
author: Elvis A.

description: This looked like a cute coffee place on Yelp so we stopped by one day.  I ordered the Matcha latte, which was a bit too sweet for me with not enough matcha flavor.  The menu seems a bit limited.  Not sure I'll be back.
author: Karen L.

description:
GREAT COFFEE!

You'd be lucky if you can find a seat here on the weekend because the seats here are usually taken by studying USF students. 

I love the simplicity and clean look of the menu on the wall. Also really like how they have a wide variety of tea lattes which can be served hot or cold (with boba). I'v tried the Jasmine Tea Latte, Early Grey Lavender Latte, and Lavender Cappuccino. All very good :) 
The tea lattes are extremely hot so it takes awhile to be able to drink it. 

Oh they also have a stamp card! Buy 10 get one Free :)
author: Leilani Y.

description:
Cute little coffee shop that also has boba tea. I wanted to find a place that has boba and free WiFi so that I can work. I used to live in LA and we have a ton of boba places with lots of seating and free WiFi. Unfortunately that's not the case in SF. 

But I found Fifty/Fifty!! Cute little place with tables and free WiFi and yummy boba! Would def come back again when I want to work away from my room.
author: Celia D.

description: After going here regularly, I will not be back after today's experience. Drinks are good, baristas not so friendly. And after today's miscommunication about how I would like my drink, which was handled wrong and was made to feel like a dumb fool, I will not foolishly return here. Done!
author: Thomas L.

description: Third wave coffee has finally struck the Inner Richmond's quiet shore, and it's delicious. This is a great space to work or study, excellent coffee and espresso, and solid food (though my cookie could have had a bit more salt). Also, they sell Ritual beans!
author: Spencer J.

description:
Best boba in SF hands down.  Can't beat the boba quality and iced honey coconut so clean.

Other bobas are chewy and hard to go back to after trying this one.
author: Taylor J.

description:
Mmm I love the Americano/espresso here. They use Ritual beans, and it's absolutely delicious and creamy! Perfect with a splash of almond milk :) They also serve other drinks, like matcha and boba (after 12p).

Great natural lighting with bright, white walls, making for a very, very Instagrammable spot. Not too big of a space, and most people here seem to be just hanging out (vs working on laptops).

They take credit cards, no minimum. Street parking/meter parking only, but it's close enough to residential that you can often get lucky with free street parking 1-2 blocks away!
author: Samantha C.

description:
They serve ritual coffee which is one of my favorite Bay Area coffees :3 The atmosphere is very minimal (menu is on the wall in black type). They put a lot of effort into making each cup of coffee so definitely order coffee if you come! They also serve boba in the afternoons, and have fruit flavored drinks :)

They have a nice selection of savory and sweet treats, including Dynamo donuts! I got an orange and chocolate scone that was a bit dry but very tasty. Apparently the banana bread is also very tasty. There's some seating along the walls, window and the back but it isn't a place you'd want to spend a lot of time in with friends.
author: Hana S.

description: Super cute cafe nestled at the corner of Geary and Spruce! A bit small, but it has some great drinks including the infamous lavender earl grey latte and also the less known hazelnut hot chocolate. Definitely a great, quiet place to study, work, or just relax. I ordered the lavender earl grey latte iced and wow was it refreshing. I usually hate floral tastes so trust me when I say it was good. I'm going back with my stuff next time so I can plop down and get some work done.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: The milk tea was terrible. It would be a great place to sit and do some work at the tables, but if it's a place you're trying to get good milk tea, don't bother. It tasted more like milk than tea.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Have been here twice already . 

The first time , I was going on a boba run with my best friend . She got the mango purée and I got the peach purée with boba . My friend's drink tasted fine , but my drink was super watered down without any hint of peach flavor . The drink basically tasted like water and boba together . After my friend tried my drink , she made me go back to change the drink which the barista was apologetic and was willing to change my drink . 

The second time , I had just finished my morning errands and had some time to spare before heading to work . Got the matcha latte with soy milk . The drink tasted bland . Can't really taste the soy milk and there was only a small hint of matcha , maybe I should've told them extra matcha . The pastry was expensive being that it tasted dry , hard , and stale .

Being there are many other boba / cafe places in the city , Fifty/fifty has room for improvements .
author: Annie L.

description: Jazmine tea latte and peach puree tea were both good. They can adjust the sweetness for you. The price is decent.
author: Sojeong K.

description:
With a minimalist interior and simple coffee and tea menu, this place sets the perfect mood for an intimate chat with an old friend or a productive work day. The music here is always set at a quiet volume and in good taste (alternative, indie, ambient electronic).

They serve Ritual coffee here, which I haven't tried, but I have had their tea, tea lattes and boba. Their lavender earl grey is much more floral than I am used to but it doesn't detract from the tea flavor at all. Additionally, I've tried their green milk tea boba and black milk tea boba -- both delicious, with strong tea flavors (I personally preferred the green milk tea over the black here). Their boba is chewy and on point. What I really like is that they have a selection of dairy alternatives you can choose to mix your teas or coffee like almond or soy :)
author: Purnima G.

description:
What a cute little cafe! 

I went for the coffee cake and it was a good choice. Of course, it would have been even better warmed up. 

The bathroom was really clean. It had a code. One thing that was a little sketchy was the fact that their were two doors. There was the door you enter with and across the room, there was another door with no lock. Thankfully nobody can through that door (shudder). 

Will be back but will probably not be using the bathroom.
author: Sarah A.

description:
This spot is cute. It's got that hipster, clean bright aesthetic going on. The pastries are good, but that's where it stops for me.
Both times, the coffee has just been so incredibly weak. The people who have accompanied even said the coffee wasn't that great, and one of them is sensitive to caffeine! 
I guess I'll try the fruit puree iced teas but other than that, my quest for a decent coffee shop in this area continues.
author: Susy C.

description: This place has the most delicious boba milk tea (I love the honey coconut flavor), and I'm personally not a coffee drinker, but walking in the door there is such an amazing aroma. The cute, simplistic environment and decor, makes for a perfectly photogenic vibe. 5050 is definitely a favorite.
author: Alex J.

description:
Seriously dainty. I felt like I was walking into a cafe that took their drips, craft coffees and boba teas seriously. Then I took a look the prices and affirmed my thoughts. 

The drinks were really good and the consistency of the boba was surprisingly perfect. However, there's something about the neighborhood cafe ambiance and the baristas that was chilling. Maybe I'm just not hipster enough. Someone give me some overalls and a fedora before my next visit.
author: Joshua F.

description: Good place to work! I managed to nab a table which was nice, and the wifi was consistent. Stayed for a couple hours with a  strong but yummy lavender earl grey latte. Friendly staff too! I'd give 4.5 stars.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I love this place! I've been coming here for nearly 4 years now and have not been disappointed by the service or the beverages. The space is minimalist, with a simple menu to match. It's a good place to work, but small so the tables tend to fill up quickly.

I'm a big coffee drinker, but I go here for the teas. The matcha tea latte always fulfills my matcha cravings. I also recommend the jasmine tea latte as well. I skip the boba here since I'm not a fan of the way they prepare it (i.e. not chewy).

Another thing I love about this cafe is that they sell baked goods from several SF bakeries. At one point, they had goodies from Mr. Holmes Bakehouse, but most recently they had pastries from Le Marais. 

I will definitely come back to fulfill my tea cravings!
author: Janet P.

description:
Really simple and minimalistic coffee/tea shop! Menu can be found on the left wall upon entry. They offer a few seats at the window/bar and a few tables around the side and back. Boyfriend got the cappuccino and got the strawberry/banana green tea. They offer boba pearls after 12pm.

Bf liked his cappuccino ($3.75). Espresso wasn't too bitter or strong.

My strawberry/banana green tea ($4) was a random pick, it says says the teas are flavored with puree. It tasted just like that.. Like a strawberry banana smoothie with..  grean tea minus the thickness of a smoothie. It was strange. I don't know if I like it or not, taha. If you're feeling a little adventurous you should try it! My go-to is usually jasmine green tea, which I'd definitely like to come back and try next time~
author: Tina N.

description:
Love this cute little coffeeshop! My friends and I were waiting to get dim sum nearby, so we wandered over here to get our boba fix. They have tapioca available only after noon, so we were in luck with our timing that day. I got an iced honey coconut tea latte because it sounded cool. Delicious!

Peaceful and lovely place to get some reading done. The baristas are very friendly, and this has an overall welcoming atmosphere. It can be tricky to get a seat in such a small coffeeshop, but even if you drop by and get a drink to-go, it's well worth the trek!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
My friends and I stopped by after a long bike ride. We were craving something refreshing along the lines of bubble tea, but we happened to be near Fifty / Fifty and there were so many glowing reviews.

The coffee/tea shop has such a nice, sunbathed atmosphere. It feels like a trendy Aussie coffee shop that serves Asian-inspired beverages. While there are only a few tables, it would be an awesome place to read or get some work done. 

I also love how straightforward their menu is. They offer unique variations of milk tea and green tea fruit purees. I went with the iced honey coconut milk tea. Their milk teas are made with Clover milk, but I opted for almond, which costs extra. You can also add tapioca for 25 cents. 

My friends ordered the iced matcha milk tea and the mango green tea fruit puree, and everything tasted great. The drinks are fresh, subtle, and not cloyingly sweet or artificial like at other bubble tea places, where I always have to request a less sweetened version.

Would definitely stop by again if I'm in the area. Hopefully I'll get some Dynamo donuts next time.
author: Valerie L.

description:
First off, the wifi here sucks. 

But drinks are really good. Special flavors like lavender earl grey latte and jasmine tea latte. I haven't tried their espresso drinks yet. 

Fifty fifty also have stamp cards (you can't combine your cards). I like that this place has a good amount of lighting and you can easily find free parking nearby. 

Finally minus 1 star not only because of their wifi issue but I've gone here 3 times and twice the cashier person was super awkward. I was totally friendly and asked simple questions like what is this and that drink and the person couldn't even look at me..? Pretty awkward.

Also the latte art here is aight.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Grabbed a drink while we were waiting for a table at dimsum. 

- Honey Coconut Tea Latte - delicious

- Matcha Latte - clear winner

- Lavender Earl Grey Latte - not bad, but finishes bitter. Can't taste the bergamot with all the lavender.

- cookies are colossal and divine
author: Julia C.

description:
--- The Flavors Of Coffee (And Tea) ---

Inner Richmond: Fifty / Fifty
Castro: Sixty / Nine
Haight Ashbury: Four / Twenty
Presidio: Twentysix / Pointtwo
Hunters Point: One / Eightseven
Marina: Thirtysix / Twentyfour / Thirtysix
FiDi: Mill / Ions

Cold Brew coffee x Strawb Nana tea
Mixed em 50/50; the only way, son.
#twodrinksonecupmuggafuggas
author: Dan B.

description:
Love love love their coffee selection. They know how to make a nice cup of craft joe. The atmosphere is also very inviting. Baristas are very welcoming and willing to customize a drink to your liking and are knowledgeable. Granted drinks are on the pricier side, that's the norm nowadays for good coffee in the city. My only gripe is probably the fact that they charge $0.50 for a sub of almond milk (even though you only add a small dash of it to your coffee). Either way, i'll probably still come back. They have several spots and a small bar for laptops if you're looking for a place to study/get some work done. However spots are limited.

If you're not in the mood for coffee, I would definitely recommend their Earl Grey latte which is made very well. Personally, i'm a big lover in having the tea flavor sign through and they are able to balance the strong nodes of the tea with the appropriate amount of milk here.
author: Diane T.

description:
Nice little corner coffee shop on Geary!

The interior is cozy, but also very clean and almost makes your forget all the craziness and traffic going on just outside.

I had the Green Tea Mango...it's an iced green tea with mango puree mixed in...very refreshing!

I am not a big coffee fan, but had to give this place props because it is definitely a change of pace from the norm of Geary Avenue stores.

Happy Eating!
author: Bradley H.

description:
Simplistic, delicious drinks, great health score (100/100!). This place is a cute gem. It's a little out of place, but the atmosphere was nice and the cafe was bright and well-lit.

I get suckered into designs of more hip coffee joints. Definitely won me with the mason jars, and the pastries, and the boba. It's a cute fusion of boba place, hipster coffee, and delicious pastries, and Dynamo donuts.

Got the croissant, which was pretty good. Not the best I've had, but definitely flaky and yummy still. My friend got the Peach Puree Green Tea. Which was yummy and wasn't too sweet. It was just perfect.

The girls working there were all very nice and cute too!
author: Josie W.

description:
What a wonderful gem.  

I've had this place bookmarked for a couple months and am so happy I finally got to try it out. I wish it was closer to work or home because I would be here every.single.day.  They had a great selection of pastries, coffee and tea and plenty of places to sit.  

The barista was great and extremely helpful. I ordered a strawberry muffin (delicious) and an iced lavender earl tea.  I am a huge fan of all things lavender (honey lavender ice cream, lavender shortbread etc) so I was excited they had a lavender tea.  

The tea was very well made and perfect for the unusually hot SF weather.  I will definitely be back soon!  Love this place and definitely recommend.  The service is great, they have great tea, pastries and since I'm not a coffee drinker I can't vouch for that but if it's like everything else, then it's probably perfect.  Check it out.

Oh and just a tip, they don't serve tapioca until noon so if you're craving boba, you might want to wait until then.  I wasn't able to try the boba because I was there around 10 am but will definitely order it next time.  I can't wait to return to have another glass of their iced lavender earl grey tea latte.  It was amazing!
author: Christine P.

description:
I dropped by in the afternoon hoping to get some work done. There are only 3 tables for 2 that have access near a power outlet, and they were all taken. However, two of the tables had only one person so I shamelessly joined one of them because I had already trekked all the way out here from North Beach and I didn't feel like going anywhere else!

I tried the honey coconut tea latte with boba, which while tasty, wasn't as amazing as expected from reading all the raving reviews. It was a little on the watery side and did not have strong honey or coconut flavors, but more of a subtle hint of the flavors. I also tried a chocolate chip cookie (which they'll heat up for you) which was just the way I liked it, a slight crunch on the outer edges and chewy in the middle. 

Service was a little brusque, and the woman who works there had a very unfriendly and cold demeanor, so deducting one star for service. I get that you're a hipster but would it kill you to have a smile on your face when greeting your customers? 

Not sure if I'd make the trek out here again but would stop by if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Ritual coffee (cold brews, pour-overs, and more), tea lattes, boba tapioca, fruit purees (with real fruit), dynamo donuts, and other baked goods from devil's teeth baking co. Basically some of the best of SF all-in-one shop. They take their food and drink pretty seriously and do a great job ensuring quality.

Minimalist space with about five bar seats and three tables for two. However, you don't need to be shy about pulling out your laptop and getting some work done (if you can find a seat). Each table has an outlet, but you may be scrounging for an outlet at the bar seats. Wi-fi was great at 7.55 mbps up / 0.80 mbps down. 

The fruit purees had a bit of a stevia/fake sugar flavor, but I could tell they use REAL fruit from seeing fiber (and seeds for the mixed berry puree). That FOAM on top of the fruit purees though...I could really tell they gave that a good shake. The matcha tea latte was a bit bitter for my tastes, so they definitely didn't skimp on the matcha. It was very smooth with a lightweight foam to top it off.

Great place that I would definitely come back to, but maybe not worth it to go out of the way if you're passing through SF.
author: Audrey L.

description: Cute coffee shop. It's small so if you're looking for a quiet coffee shop to study at with ample seating, this is not it. But their coffee is amazing. As a USF student, I would come to pick up a lavender latte (must try) here when I had a break. Baristas are awesome and will make your drink however you order it.
author: Reyna V.

description:
I'm so glad I finally got to stop by this place. It has been on my radar for a couple of months, but I just recently stopped by the USF/Richmond area.

Service was very friendly by two employees. The menu is simple but elegant, and the cashier provided recommendations based on our tea preferences.

I also love their milk options-- soy, almond and regular milk are available! I ended up going with a Almond Milk Jasmine Tea w/ boba. Surprisingly, the drink was just as creamy as one with regular milk! I was thoroughly impressed-- the tea was strong and tasty, the boba was perfectly chewy and sweet, and the almond milk was high quality. This isn't your typical milk tea-- but it was sure tasty!

I also had a taste of the matcha green tea with regular milk and it was delicious! I am looking forward to trying the lavender tea soon!

Pastries were super fresh and I believe they had Dynamo donuts! Seating is available inside and on the side patio.
author: Jackson L.

description: My new obsession has been tea lattes and this place did not disappoint. I came here to try their lavender earl grey latte. It definitely hits the spot!! I also got their Dynamo donuts, which are always amazing but I wish they warmed it up because it was cold. Overall, a small but great spot for tea lattes!
author: Vy T.

description:
Used to really love this place, not so much anymore. Realized recently that I've been subconsciously avoiding it like the plague because of how unwelcoming and cliquey it feels. Even though I've come here at least 30+ times, the service remains cold and unfriendly. They're very unwilling to make adjustments or remake drinks. Completely unapologetic if they forget to make your drink.

Except the dude with the bleached hair. That guy's cool.
author: Jessica S.

description: Not a huge but very subtle and clean cafe. Visit the place and you'll love it.
author: Team M S.

description:
Finally got to try this place while waiting for our number to be called at a close by restaurant.

Me:  I'll have the lavender earl grey latte
Barista:  Would you like that hot or cold?
Me:  Uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh, hot.

Usually people make it difficult for baristas but I always end up making it more difficult on myself.  HOT OR COLD gosh darnit!?  I've had the lavender latte at other places but this place does it right.  The lavender and earl grey was a great balance of flavor.

The mixed berry tea was good too.  It's the perfect drink to sip on while chillin on the beach.  Make sure you have an awesome friend with you to tell you that you have lipstick on your tooth when it was really the berries from this drink.  

Great service, good drinks.  Will definitely come back.
author: Linda N.

description: Soso. The day was so clear when I was there, the shiny atmosphere was perfectly matched with this cafe. Staffs were casual and also the place was. I can not be sure for taste of coffee but it was been remembered so good to me.
author: Changmin L.

description:
I was walking to the post office with one of my friends, and we passed by this little gem. It was a hot day, and she suggested we stop by and get a drink. I'm so glad she suggested to do so! We went into the cafe, and immediately felt good vibes. The cafe is also very aesthetically pleasing, with white walls and clear menus above the barista working space. Lets talk about service and tea quality:

CUSTOMER SERVICE/AMBIANCE: The feeling of the shop is very pristine, with light music playing in the background. The person at the order station was very helpful and friendly. She helped me choose what drink I should get, as it was my first time there. I decided on getting the green tea with mango purée. We came too early to get boba, but I will be definitely getting it next time. I also got an almond croissant to go with it, which was recommended by the barista. My friend and I decided to sit outside, and we found a cute little table with two chairs to plant ourselves at. Not much after that, our drinks were ready! Only about 5 minute wait, which is excellent. My friend and I enjoyed a good conversation, as we enjoyed out drinks and pastries. 

TEA/PASTRY QUALITY: I got the Green Tea with Mango Pureé, and it was delicious! It was extremely fresh, and I loved the taste of the tea that really came through. Flavors were very crisp and the sweetness level was great. Came in a very cute mason jar, so bonus points for presentation. Loved the blend of the fresh pureé too. Loved my drink, and loved my croissant even more! Flaky outside, and delicious, sweet fluffy inside. Great recommendations from the staff! 5/5 experience regarding the service and drink/food!

Overall, this is an amazing coffee shop! I will come back to do some school work, since the wifi connection is very strong! Also is close to my campus (USF), which I appreciate! Would recommend this to anyone! Can't wait to return very soon.
author: Kiki C.

description:
Awesome tea lattes and minimalist decor~ Decided to try this place out with a friend, and I'm so glad I did! I loooove boba (they call it tea lattes and tapioca here), and their drinks are definitely up to par. 

I ordered an iced jasmine tea latte with tapioca, and it was really good! I was able to taste the Jasmine flavor without it being diluted with the milk/creamer. Their tapioca was bomb too -- chewy and sweet. 

I definitely want to come back to try the rest of their menu!
author: Robinne D.

description:
Friday, 2:00 PM. 

Quickie:
+ Drink quality
+ Service
+ Hygiene
* Layout
+ Turnaround
* Menu variety

And then...?
Simple and minimalist themes pace Fifty / Fifty. Thumbs up! 

**********
Stuffed my face in:
1. Iced latte
    + Nice aroma

Constructive comments:
*Expand food menu
author: Chuck N.

description: Had the latte, not bad at all. Quite a fine latte. Not the best not the worst. The atmosphere is just not really my preference. First time in felt like very stale energy. Bathroom too high tech for my old bones.
author: Lucianne C.

description:
My favorite neighborhood spot for when I want to treat myself to Ritual coffee! The employees are always welcoming and the lattes are made with care. I always order a latte and I can always count on the same goodness every time. I appreciate their loyalty card where every 10 drinks gets you a free cup of coffee. 

The flaky croissants and the buttery scones are a lifesaver for when you need a pick-me-up on those groggy mornings. Donuts on Sundays!

It's a nice place for a morning conversation with your bestie but if you're looking for a place to laptop camp, this place can get busy with not a lot of tables to choose from. 

Still, this is by far my favorite go-to place for when I want to roll out of bed and get my caffeine fix.
author: Aesun K.

description: Terrible latte. It doesn't even seem that they using espresso but rather the brewed coffee for it.
author: Damir S.

description:
Got the matcha tea latte - decent but not amazing. The Americano was pretty meh. If I'm in the area again, I would be up for trying their fruity tea drinks to-go. 

It's not a reliable place to work at. There's only 3 tables with plugs, 3-4 small window seats, and 2 tables outside that are always full.
author: Inga C.

description:
This is a cute little coffee shop in the Inner Richmond/USF area, where if you don't know about it already you will probably never see it.  It is located on the corner on Geary and just kind of blends into the scene without any particular landmark that stands out grabbing for your attention.  Their menu is painted onto the wall, which is pretty creative, but I can imagine that making changes to the menu is difficult as a result.

I like to order the Matcha Latte from here.  Usually there is a good balance between the bitter and sweet.  The last time I got it, it started off tasting very concentrated, but once you got to the middle where it mixed well with the milk, it was better.

There are only about 4 total tables so getting a solid study space for yourself will be hit or miss depending on the day of the week and time, and the chairs swivel which is nice.

Fifty Fifty also serves donuts from Dynamo Donuts (how awesome that we don't have to travel all the way to the Mission for these delicious pastry creatures.  Can we get some cronuts in here next? PLEASE...I just don't want to stand in that line....

I haven't tried their boba here, only because it just doesn't seem like a place where you come for that.  Maybe one of these days when I don't feel like hunting on Geary or Clement for boba, I'll give Fifty Fifty a try....just maybe.

Overall: nice vibe, nice customer service, clean and cute - as a coffee shop should be.
author: Elisha Y.

description:
I am so happy I found this place! Tried the peach green tea with boba. Really yummy and just the right amount of sweetness. The tapioca pearls were just the right texture and sweetness too. 

Ambiance was nice with some seating and large windows to people watch. It's super easy to get there on the 38 or 38R--exit at the Spruce stop. The service was wonderful too. It's always nice to see a smiling face. 

FYI, it's a great place for drinks but there isn't a large selection of pastries. Good thing the area has lots of other options for food and snacks.
author: Susan G.

description: Totally agree with their coffee selection and choice of goodies(loved the banana bread). It was refreshing to see the delivery of fresh baked goods from another small business. The place itself is pretty quiet, bustling with a collection of different ppl every now and then. I was here on a Sunday morning studying and people watching and it was pretty relaxing. Before leaving I got myself a lavender milk tea(they serve boba as well!) and that was amazing. I also got more banana bread to share with my niece :)
author: Nessa R.

description:
I moved to this neighborhood months before and only discovered this cute corner cafe after a friend raved about their coffee and tea. Trusting her, I gave this place a shot and now it has become one of my favorite coffee spots in the city. 

Fifty/Fifty has a great staff and seems to be growing their menu options. Their coffee beans are from Ritual Coffee, and they can prepare it in different ways: standard drip, pour over, cold brew, etc. I am a big fan of their milk tea lattes, which can be done hot or cold. Their Match Green Tea Latte is delicious, as is the Jasmine and the Lavender Earl Grey. Tapioca/Boba is available after 12pm, and is the perfect chewy texture. They serve Dynamo Donuts too if you want to pair that tea or coffee with something sweet in the morning. 

The best part: they take credit card, Apple Pay, and Android Pay through Square, which means I never have to worry about bringing cash. They have a great stamp card system too: one free drink after purchasing 10 drinks! It's a great place to grab a drink and chat with someone or get some reading done. On the warmer days, there is outdoor seating, with tables on the sidewalk.
author: Denise D.

description:
Fifty / Fifty is a small, serene tea&coffee shop flooded with natural light that bounces off white walls and 3 small tables + 3 bench tops. The beautifully simple menu is painted on the left wall, and a small display showcases a handful of bakery items (such as scones from Devil's Baking Teeth Co) alongside a list of food options like Chinese pancakes (bing).

Now, what really sets the ambiance is the undeniable SILENCE. There is no background music, and the seated customers are all busy being productive in some shape or form. So, imagine how out-of-place my loud voice must have been...

We got out of there as fast as we could. And, well, there were no open seats anyhoo haha.

I opted for the GREEN TEA with MANGO FRUIT PURÉE, $3.50 for a regular, $4 for a large (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fifty-fifty-coffee-and-tea-san-francisco?select=0FowYNFKajf7csbQy7e6rQ#wKx-gz0Ypb5IbsLG2jgU_w). I adored it. The fruit puree was incredibly refreshing but not overpowering, allowing the smooth bitterness of the green tea to shine through. As usual, I asked for less ice to lessen the watering down.

My friend ordered the HONEY COCONUT TEA LATTE, $3.25 for a regular, $3.75 for a large, served iced or hot (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fifty-fifty-coffee-and-tea-san-francisco?select=0FowYNFKajf7csbQy7e6rQ#-bdWH_AY2dO5QTI_qWPg7w). After 12 PM, you can add in tapioca for $0.50. I didn't try her drink, but she enjoyed it!

Given the quality of their drinks, you might be torn 50/50 on what to order. Solution? Get both. You'll thank me later.
author: Adele F.

description:
3.5 stars. Decided to make a quick coffee run while in the city and wanted to check out someplace new. 

I was feeling a bit adventurous so I ordered the lavender earl grey latte. It was nice and milky, floral (you can def taste the lavender), but maybe not really my fave although I was glad I gave it a try. 

The ambience of the place was inviting and clean, small amount of tables for those who would like to do some work or study. Their menu and barista area was very clean and white, which I really like.

I would want to come back to try their other drinks - mocha & matcha latte if I'm around the area.

I'll update this on a later time if I happen to return (:
author: Rachel T.

description: Delicious chai latte! Only bummer is there aren't a lot of places to sit and get work done and only one electrical outlet to charge a laptop/phone. Free wifi though!
author: Shannon P.

description: Got a large size latte but it is not fully filled... When i saw my latte,i felt it was already drank 20% by someone... If you want to serve less then provide a smaller cup! I ordered a large size so please make it real. Otherwise, what is the point of getting a LARGE Size drink?
author: Melissa K.

description: This is a very small coffee shop in the inner richmond district of San Francisco.  There isn't much seating so you're lucky if you do get one!  I ordered the honey milk tea and was surprised that I actually loved it!  They can make it hot or cold.  I always get that when I come here.  My friends have had their matcha milk tea and love it.  Highly recommend this place if you want coffee or tea!
author: Mikayla M.

description: Simple, minimalist, clean, good light, nice music (that is thankfully not too loud). Also, they serve the best coffee cake I've ever had, from Jane bakery.
author: Charlotte B.

description:
Stopped by here on a recent trip to San Fran with the boyfriend and I was not disappointed! The whole vibe of the store was very hip and modern, a really cute place for a date. They had a  variety of selections, from coffees, tea lattes, and flavored teas. Let's start with the review.

Service: The employees were super sweet and nice. I always feel like service also plays a huge part everywhere and anywhere. No matter how good the food or drinks are at location if the service sucks it'll ruin the taste of the food as well. I was served by a the guy with the cool hair who was sweet enough to make me a bear in my tea latte. He helped me choose which drinks I should get and was really helpful, not to mention patient when i asked 100 questions. If you want cute coffee this is the place to be!

Drinks: I got the early grey lavender tea latte and it was one of the best lattes I have ever tried. It was not overly too sweet, really creamy, and rich, just the way tea lattes should be. It tasted just right on a cold day. My boyfriend also got the mango green tea with boba! The boba was cooked well and the tea was really good. I think I also saw some fruit bits in it as well. 

Overall my first experience and certainly not my last was a good one. I will make it a tradition to visit here every SF trip. It was hard to find at first but it is on the corner of spruce!
author: Victoria P.

description:
My friend from out of town was visiting and I was tasked with finding several new food places to spend try out with her. I go to the Mission or the Sunset for food, but I decided to branch out and see what the Richmond district has to office. I'm a tea lover, a coffee lover and a lover of all things sweet.  

So first, the food/drinks. I went on a Saturday so they had these Dynamo Donuts (which I had yet to try). These donut was amazing. After reading the reviews I decided to try the tea lattes - both the honey coconut and the lavender earl grey were great as hot drinks. I returned the next day to try the boba everyone was raving about here on Yelp, and I will agree that it's pretty darn good. The lavender earl grey wasn't my favorite as an iced drink though - I'll just try something different. 

They have a public restroom for customers only, which is awesome because it's clean (and we know how a lot of places don't have restrooms in SF so this alone got them to the 5th star in my book). 

It was a little difficult to see from the street and the inside is fairly place and minimalistic, but I assume that is on purpose. I have no real complaints or recommendations. Try it out, it's worth it. Definitely my new favorite spot to hit up. Mind you, I live in the east Bay Area so this isn't easy for me to get to two days in a row, but it proved to be worth it!
author: Tyler V.

description: This is a cute little place that my friends and I stopped by on the way to Japantown. I got the matcha latte with tapioca pearls and my friends got the hot chocolate and the mocha. They said their drinks were pretty good, and I particularly liked the matcha (although the boba was a little on the starchy side). I would definitely try to stop here again to try some of their other tea lattes, but if you're not into that, they have really good chocolate chip cookies!!
author: Cindy N.

description:
My only complaint is finding a seat might be difficult! I wish they have more tables :( DESPITE THIS! I lovee lovee their matcha tea latte...I have yet to try anything else for my love for matcha renders too darn deep, BUT! I will definitely try their other drinks...one day and maybe even snag myself one of those dynamite donuts.

I mainly come here to study btw. For anyone who is curious about the noise level. its perfect, simply perfect. Even on a rainy day, the light that shines through their window just lights up the place nicely. But again, come early! It is possible to find people camping at their table for hours (myself included).
author: Mary L.

description:
I love 50/50! 
Warning: the boba seems to always run out towards the end of the day (maybe around late afternoon)-which is strange because I'm pretty sure they don't even start serving it until noon. More boba please! 

I am obsessed with all the drinks here, and the pastries are really good as well. The tea lattes (especially the matcha lattes), the coffee/espresso options, everything is good! I always try to coerce my friends to go here with me whenever possible :)
author: Marilyn M.

description:
I was just passing by and decided to give this place a shot. The people working weren't particularly friendly for a place with such a nice atmosphere. 

Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the beverage. I got the mango fruit green tea and it was really diluted.
author: Kerry L.

description:
I came across this cute place as I was taking my dad to his doctors appointment. It's so cute and adorable!

I didn't know what to order at first but they gave me a few recommendations! I decided to get the jasmine tea latte and it's super good! I'll definitely come back!
author: Sandy C.

description:
Super chill spot with lots of great lighting.

We tried a matcha tea latte served hot. Super smooth and tasty, something out of a dream. Frickin' perfect.

Dynamo donuts is a big plus if you don't feel like traveling to the other side of town.

Just the perfect mix of everything that keeps me coming back. It's the perfect coffee shop you never knew you had.
author: Anthony N.

description: Cute little cafe with a cute name tucked quietly in the busy street of Geary. Menu is simple which is always great. If it's good, need not be fancy. I went for the coconut honey since it was different. But it didn't wow me. I can taste the coconut, well, barely. This fell under the "tea" category, but i couldn't taste the slightest hint of tea. Bobas, fresh and chewy which are always good addition to this drink. Service was good, so I will come back for the Jasmine or Salted Caramel just to try it out.
author: Em T.

description:
Cute little coffee shop. Nice selection of drinks, I have yet to try the boba though. The chai is my favourite. If you order for here they serve it in a mason jar!
Service is usually very nice. Patient and willing to explain the menu to you.
The reason I gave this place a 4/5 is because the pastries are a bit pricey. I think $3 for a donut and everything else...
I also recommend trying the bings! They're both very good and a nice little side dish for your drink
author: Bianca M.

description: Order the Honey coconut boba. Real coconut shreds at the bottom, yum! I'm not even sure if this is tea or just some magical honey coconut drink but I don't care. I also got a mocha and it was fine, nothing to write home about but perfectly acceptable.
author: A P.

description: Super cute atmosphere and good pastries, but the employees aren't friendly. The only words the girl at the register spoke to me were "Seven dollars". Not even a hint of a smile. Atmosphere and good eats will only get you so far- this would have been a five star review if the employees didn't act like my presence was such an inconvenience.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
Awesome cafe for the Asian side of me that is lactose intolerant. Great lattes and also has boba after noon- Sundays they tend to run out of boba early so I'd call ahead to check.

Everything here looks delicious, the almond croissant was bomb, and I'd love to try more of the baked goods and different tea lattes.
Don't forget to bring in your punch card:)
author: Nancy W.

description: They make a great espresso drink that could rival any in the Bay Area, in my opinion. Free wifi and comfortable interior arrangement. Very impressed.
author: Jason W.

description: I usually treat my son with a drink a few times a month after school. He loves the drink. I usually get one myself. Service is fast and friendly. Nice to be able to take him to a place I know we both enjoy.
author: Maria H.

description: Simple but delicious menu. Free wifi. Just wish the chairs were more comfortable and they had Sugar alternatives.
author: Jess F.

description: Even if there were other third wave cafes around ( there really isn't, the Richfield is too far) this would be a stand out. Ritual bean beverages, expertly made. Interesting tea drinks, though I thought the lavender a bit too perfumed, esp in combo with earl grey tea. A fragrance bomb.
author: E. W.

description:
lavender earl grey iced tea with tapioca pearls tasted disgusting. It tasted like soap and was difficulty to drink. 
The matcha iced tea was similarly gross - really gritty and watered down. 

The peach that a friend got tasted ok. Would not come here and waste $4.50 again.
author: Amanda F.

description:
tl;dr: Our absolutely favorite coffee/tea shop in the neighborhood. Skip the coffee and get the Peach Tea. Don't forget your stamp card!

Service: 5/5
Super friendly staff and quick turnaround on orders. We would get drinks here at least once a week for a year when we lived nearby and never had any issues with service at all. Bathroom requires a code to get in, but you can always ask the barista for it. Free and accessible WiFi too.

Drinks: 5/5
We definitely recommend getting the peach tea! It's a green tea mixed with a sweet peach compote. Hand shaken and served with ice. It's really refreshing and a great match for a hot and sunny day. Their lattes are pretty good, but we would always get their teas.

Ambiance: 5/5
Super hip, clean, and minimalistic.

Value: 4/5
It's not going to be as cheap as brewing tea or coffee yourself and I would say it's slightly above average in terms of price, but definitely worth it.
author: NoonNarin N.

description: Really cute place on Geary near USF. They have Boba here!! I got a matcha green tea latte with boba and it was delish!!! Few people study here, but the tables are small so it would be hard to accommodate large groups. Nice and quiet  they also have a few seating areas outside. I think that will be nice when the weather is warm.
author: Jackie N.

description: I adore this place! Perfect chill vibe and tasty dynamo donuts and iced lavender earl grey teas for a lazy Saturday. Had their maple apple and glazed bacon donut today, would love to try the strawberry one next time!
author: P C.

description: Matcha almond latte ($5.25 for a large) was as good as any I've had. The space is airy and I didn't have much trouble finding a seat to work. The chairs are kind of uncomfortable and the staff a little curt though.
author: Grace Y.

description:
Look, do I have to say any more than this: Lavender earl grey tea latte.
Yes.
Get it.
This little cafe makes great drinks, and the lavender earl grey tea latte is my favorite treat when I am in the neighborhood.

There are a few tables and chairs, usually taken up by people with laptops. They will usually share the table with you, though sometimes grudgingly. Best to pop in and get the goods, and then continue on your merry way.
author: Rachel M.

description: Fresh tasty pastries and excellent coffee. The vibe is mellow and easy to do work there.
author: Liz O.

description: Such a great place with a nice quiet ambiance that could be good for writers and inspiration. This cafe, I believe, is located in what is called the Inner Richmond. The area is placid and sunny, and full of spirit and antiquity. I walked for a while and did not find a single Starbucks in the area, which is probably good for small businesses like this one. I ordered an iced tea that was really good. The first sip was reminiscent of Bacardi, so I took another to be sure it wasn't rum. It was actually tea, but it was rich in flavor and very distinct. I'm glad to have found this place and experienced their tea. I think they could use some outdoor seating as well as the cafe only has a window at the front.
author: Blandie M.

description:
Still my favorite coffee shop in SF!

I like that I can get literally any drink here and be happy with it. My favorites are, in order: lavender earl grey latte (iced), honey coconut latte (iced with boba) and black tea latte. 

If you see the twice-baked almond croissant available, SNAG IT. I know it's expensive for a croissant, but the crunchy outside contrasted with the flaky, custard-filled inside is the stuff of dreams. You can ask for pastries to be heated up!

The interior is bright and airy, with high ceilings, white walls and light wood furniture. Definitely "instagrammable," if you're into that (I'm guilty!)

Seating here is limited -- on warmer days, there's two tables set up outside, but otherwise expect to share a tiny table with a stranger or sit in the booth facing the street. If you're waiting for your drink, you can also sit on the bench next to the bathroom lol. Outlets are limited, but the store itself is tiny so that's to be expected.

The bathroom here is spacious and always clean, which is a huge plus for me, especially in SF.

Everyone that works here is super sweet, patient and helpful while you're deciding what to order. Special shoutout to Jeder for consistent great service. I saw him dealing with a large crowd of tourist customers quickly and professionally and was very impressed :)
author: Katherine V.

description: one of my favorite cafes in the city! super close to my apartment and always there for where i need a pick me up especially for boba. i enjoy their baked goods too--often get cookies or banana bread. there is very little seating but when i manage to snag a spot consider myself planted for the day. the wifi is fast and outlets along the wall. the large windows bring in lots of light and fills up the space. the baristas are always really nice and drinks are perfect every time.
author: Alison M.

description: Kind of over the overpriced, snobby SF coffee scene.  I came in and ordered 3 coffees to go (pour over, one regular, and one iced). I asked for cream and splenda for my friends coffee and got a incredulous look-like how dare you doctor our drinks and then was directed to the side bar to get them.  The coffee was good but honestly not worth the extra $$ or attitude.
author: Raina D.

description:
I recently moved into the neighborhood and have been longing for a place that isn't Starbucks or Peet's. Trust me, I go to both -- and have a strong loyalty to the latter. BUT, when possible, I more often than not choose an independent coffee/tea shop (especially for studying). Fifty/Fifty is an awesome spot. They serve Ritual Coffee and have a small but solid list of teas, Asian boba teas, and of course espresso- or coffee- based beverages. I often drop by in the afternoon so I imagine in the morning they have pastries to munch on. They have these delicious "Awesome Bar" granola bars for sale. I'm addicted to the salty peanut which resembles a deconstructed and healthier version of a Snickers Bar. Hello peanut, chocolate, oat, and sugar loveliness! I've had their espresso and their iced tea (which, daily, is ginger peach). Both are mighty tasty.

They have free wifi and a limited number of seating. There are about five or six barstools up front and a few tables for two so be prepared to not sit if you plan on staying put. It's a small space, and I wish it was bigger -- but I guess its coziness is part of the charm. I wish, more than anything, that they were open later. I'm often needing my second cup of coffee or tea just before or after dinner so it'd be great if they stayed open beyond 6 or 7 PM... Like at least til 8 would be wonderful. *cough cough* *hint hint* Nevertheless, I'm thankful for this place! (Oh, and they have a loyalty card so make sure you get stamped each time!)
author: James Z.

description:
Don't know how I hadn't heard of Ritual coffee prior to my first few visits here, is quite delicious. What's even better is that they also sell Dynamo doughnuts! Tried a maple bacon apple doughnut and it was pretty gourmet...for a doughnut. Very clean and no nonsense cafe just outside of the USF campus, it's now my go-to cafe when I'm in the Richmond district.
