Also there's this barista with the biggest green eyes I've ever seen. She's very easy on the eyes haha
author: Aaron C.

description:
Stopped in for pearl (boba) tea. The pearls were the most fresh homemade pearls I have ever tasted.


The tea was fresh as well. A nice little find!
author: Ava I.

description:
Fifty / Fifty is a quaint cafe on the corner of Spruce and Geary and it has an awesome mix of Ritual coffee and tea. (Option for boba after noon.) 
You must order the Jasmine Tea Latte. You will not regret it. I typically order it with half the sugar and if I had the budget, I wish I could drink this every morning. The lattes are great but if you want to substitute almond milk, you have to pay an extra dollar (a bit pricey, IMO). If you come on the weekends, they have a great selection of Dynamo Doughnuts you could order and their pastry selection in general is delicious.
There are a few small tables you could take over if you needed work space, too.
Warning- if you're in a rush, I wouldn't recommend coming in here because it'll typically take ten minutes for you to order and then receive your drink.
author: Grace L.

description: Simple pastry and drink menu. I faithfully ordered the Lavender Tea and Asparagus pastry every morning when I worked down the street.
author: Esther J.

description: Never coming here again. Service extremely unfriendly, and unwelcoming. Also there are never any seats. Bye
author: Steven S.

description: Reminiscent of a blue bottle coffee I went to recently in Venice Beach. Beautiful marble counter tops and a modern feel, but not in your face snooty or hip. I ordered a peach puree tea and it was delicious! They even use real peaches in there. Light and refreshing. I have yet to try anything else on the menu, but I will be back
author: Liana Nicole C.

description:
The drinks are okay. 
Tastes kind of watered down but the strawberry banana drink is good. 
I sat in there for a little over an hour and their WiFi shut down on me. 
Don't come here for their WiFi.
author: Byron T.

description: This is a very cute little coffee shop. I've had a few of their lattes. Their early grey latte is really good, but I would recommend another drink if you do not like things too sweet. They used to have a salted caramel latte a few years ago, but I guess they don't have it anymore. The salted caramel late was really good, and my favorite, so I hope they bring it back. Their matcha latte is also really good with a nice matcha flavor, but I think they need to mix the matcha in a little better because when you get your drink, you can still see a few clumps of matcha inside it. Overall, i recommend that you come here if your looking for a nice small coffee shop with good service.
author: Ambur -.

description:
Only been once, so take it with a grain of salt.  

Nice cute cafe with a refreshing adult atmosphere.  I ordered a macchiato.  I didn't say, "espresso macchiato".  Just "macchiato."  Big mistake.  So the barista launched into the whole bit about "...double-shot topped with a dollop of milk foam", yada, yada, yada.  At least the barista knew what a proper macchiato was--AND she knew that kids seem to think "macchiato" is some sugary creamy bombastic coffee-Starbucks-monstrosity!  I was a little miffed that the barista thought I was so young to EVEN THINK that; but I guess I should take that as a compliment?  

I don't like coffee in a paper cup--ever.  I hate dessert coffee fraps/slushes in a plastic cup.  Boba-cha (milk-tea) is the exception.  Espresso served in anything but a ceramic cup should be verboten!  Just say [in your best German accent]--"NIEN!"  I gave five stars because, not only does Fifty/Fifty serve an exceptional iced matcha (my wife's order); and not only do they have ceramic cups; but they have MACCHIATO cups.  Not coffee, not espresso--but macchiato cups.  Impressive.  Bravo!  

The espresso was a little mild for my taste, but it wasn't burnt or ground from over roasted beans.  Cool.
author: Stephen F.

description:
I've been here several times, and its a really solid place. I just wish it was a little bigger, for the few times when there were multiple people doing what I was doing - working on computers. Actually, if you see there's a lack of tables and you're a solo person at the tables for two, help a sister out and clear out some of your crap so other people can share a table. How about that?

I'm still giving them a 4-star, even though the caffeine leaves something to be desired. Namely, its catered to the children at USF. And I mean Children. Usually I get the Matcha latte, which is a little sweet but understandable because its matcha. If you don't add a little more sweet to it, it tastes bitter. So...I decided to get their salted caramel latte. DO NOT TOUCH THIS UNLESS YOU WANT DIABETES IN A CUP. Seriously. I was about to bounce off the wall from SUGAR, not caffeine. So for the children out there who want to be grown up and get a coffee, but hate the bitterness of coffee...salted caramel. It's just hot syrup.

The space itself is pretty small. About 5-6 stools against the front windows, and 3 small 2-person tables along the side wall. The first time I came, there was a pack of about 8 police officers who hung around drinking coffee. Huh. Given the police station is around the corner, that's fair I guess. 

They change their wifi daily, and it tends to be a dessert or ingredient. But the wifi is free, and very strong. If you come when school's out, you basically get the whole place to yourself. If you come when school's in session, good luck finding a seat.
author: Lily W.

description: Yay for lavender! I got a lavendar cappucino and it was awesome. The workers were super friendly too.
author: Penny S.

description: Great little coffee shop that's open nice and early. It's probably the only place I know where you can get milk tea at 7am (called tea lattes here). After noon, they have tapioca which you can add to any of your drinks! I love the honey lavender earl grey - it's excellent hot or cold. They also have a stellar hazelnut hot chocolate never gotten food here, but they have pastries that look so, so, good. The temptation is always there.
author: Aaron T.

description:
After reading an article stating that this coffee shop is the "best in Inner Richmond" I've had my heart set on stopping by. They brew Ritual Coffee (my favorite!!!) and have a nice extended selection of tea latte beverages, non-caffeinated drinks, and pastries. 

The bf got his mainstay, a hot mocha, and I branched out and tried an iced salted caramel tea latte. He likes Ritual's mocha from their storefronts and this one was no different. If you like sweeter drinks and want to diverge from coffee, the salted caramel tea latte is a good choice! 

We also indulged in one of the Dynamo Donuts they have on the weekends. The maple bacon was really tasty and fresh even at noon. 

I had to take one star off for their lack of seating! We had to squeeze into the bar seating when a table was preferred. Perhaps they should put some cafe tables outside? Something to consider.
author: Liz G.

description: Stopped in while waiting for a table at Hong Kong Lounge II across the street and grabbed a lavender earl grey latte. I'm lactarded so I got the almond milk upgrade and must say that it was delicious! Very sweet without being cloying.
author: Casey S.

description: Usually come here for the coffee and quiet sitting for some study sessions. This time came by mid afternoon for some boba and it was pretty good. I got the Honey Coconut with Boba and enjoyed it very much. Fresh boba, not too much ice and just enough to satisfy the taste buds. Not the number 1 boba spot in city, but enjoyable.
author: John M.

description: I've been coming here in the mornings on my way to work for a drip coffee and sometimes a muffin pretty regularly.  The prices are reasonable and I've never had a bad experience.  There is one thing I do have to say and I hope management or the owners read this and take it into consideration.  The two Asian women who work there in the mornings are the coldest and most unsmiling baristas I've ever met in my life.  I've not once seen them crack any semblance of a smile in the entire time I've been coming.  I don't just mean RBF.  It's full on stink face, both of them.  They are also not engaging at all.  No "hello", "good morning", nothing.  Just the minimal amount of talking to complete the transaction.  Just to be clear, I'm not saying they are mean or bitchy because they are not.  It's impossible for me to know if they are like this all the time or if they absolutely hate being there but it makes a big difference in making customers feel welcome.
author: P.J. D.

description:
"A" and I were driving to Trader Joe's when he decided to look up something on Yelp and Fifty / Fifty Coffee and Tea popped up with photos of some delicious pastries!  Well, one look at the photos and we decided we'd have to stop by sometime the very next day.

So we walked over on Sunday morning and they don't have a huge selection of pastries, but we ended up getting two donuts - salted caramel and lemon buttermilk - as well as a twice baked almond croissant.  The salted caramel tasted a lot more citrus-y than salted caramel.  The lemon buttermilk was deeelicious!  I also really enjoyed the almond croissant.

We didn't try any of the beverages.  Neither of us are into coffee, but we might try their tea one of these days!
author: Kris L.

description: Get mango purée with boba, very yummy. Peach purée tasted weird like tap water but overall I still give five stars for the amazing service and accommodation for making a new drink for my friend :)
author: Karen J.

description: Absolutely recommend this place. I have been here multiple times and have not been disappointed (yet)! The baristas are all very nice and patient. I have made multiple special requests for my drinks, and they made them to perfection. I highly recommend their lavender tea latte (iced is better), but you can also request for lavender syrup to be added to your coffeinated drink! The first time I was here, I couldn't make up my mind, so I got both, a lavender iced tea latte and a regular lavender latte :) Loved both. Most of all-the times I've been back, I've received very consistent drinks. The microfoam in the lattes is always perfect!
author: Yelena D.

description: I love this place. Small, trendy, cozy and quiet. Drinks are always good, atmosphere is always conducive for working, and the music is always chill.
author: Robbie R.

description: A nice, quiet hipster coffee shop with lots of natural light. The matcha latte is outstanding. Pastries looked delicious. Some minimal study space.
author: Ivana J.

description:
Tea is on point. Huge fan of this place as it's right next to our friend's place.

They use real matcha in their latte. It's nice and bitter, but they sweeten it just enough so that it retains a hint of bitterness, and thus, its matcha character. If you find that it is too bitter, then you are not drinking proper matcha, and what you may *actually* enjoy is "matcha-flavored things" without the actual characteristic of matcha. There is no shame in this, but do note that this is actually decent proper matcha and I believe they make it well.

They also have a fantastic lavender earl grey milk latte (it's basically milk tea if you order it cold - after 12pm they have boba, too) which is a must for lavender lovers! I also picked up the hazelnut hot chocolate. It is, basically, like drinking liquefied Nutella, which is exactly as good as it sounds. (No sarcasm. Truly a dream.)

Oh yes...and there's stamp cards. Visiting friends is always fun, but it's EXTRA fun when I can also get quality milk tea out of it.
author: Robbin A.

description: Cappuccino and milk teas are amazing, and picked up a cookie for as a snack was an incredible idea!
author: Wilson P.

description:
I went here for the 2nd time today to get boba. I got a classic milk tea with Boba. It's definitely overpriced. Large size was $4.25 plus $0.5. Wasn't even that good.

$3 espresso....Get the f out of here.

If you are going there for Salted caramel milk tea. They don't have it anymore. 

Customer service was not good either, too much talking about their personal stuff and negative vibes from this one girl I saw today. Not pleasant at all.

I am not going back here for the 3rd time.
author: C M.

description: Staff was friendly and the drinks were great.  Downfall is that the place is small and they do not have that many seats.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
Came to get a cold drink as it was nearby and we were on the waiting list for HK Lounge II.

Really beautiful interior, though the drinks are nothing special. Had the iced vanilla latte. Also, they forgot my order despite there only being 2 other people in the cafe while I was there. 

It was meh.
author: Elisa L.

description:
4.5 stars. 

This quaint coffee shop is small and cozy for those catch up sessions with friends and quiet enough for study time. I love the clean and simple interior design and the delicious Ritual coffee they serve! You'll find your favorite espresso drinks (with syrups), loose leaf teas, "tea lattes" which are like boba drinks (yes they do have tapioca/boba after 12pm!), and also green tea fruit puree drinks that are refreshing! I've tried a drink from every category and enjoyed them all. If you're hungry, they do serve pastries and donuts from local San Francisco bakeries. 

Docked 1/2 point for the hit or miss customer service. Most of the time the employees are happy and cheery, but I've had a few encounters where I felt like I was bothering the employee with my order. 

Overall, I would hop on a 15 minute shuttle ride just to enjoy a relaxing work session at fifty/fifty! 

+wifi 
+outlets
+stamp cards (buy 10 get 1 free)
+open windows=natural light
+good music selection (not too loud) 
+clean bathroom
author: Christina N.

description:
THE. PEARLS. ARE. LEGIT.

As the boba queen, I have to say I'm EXTREMELY impressed with their tapioca. It's the perfect consistency and sweet! 

I've recently been getting my teas with half sugar though, so I feel like it cuts out flavor. (Sugar makes everything better). I had the matcha milk tea with half sugar. It tasted kind of watery... :(
But the pears make up for it. ALL OF IT. Can I have a cup full of just tapioca please? Kthanksbye.
author: Cassie C.

description:
Hazelnut latte was creamy and delicious. Great service.

If you are in the neighborhood, check it out. 

I'll be back.
author: Ian S.

description: The matcha green tea latte is SO pretty. Idk how the matcha sits perfectly on top of the milk without mixing together. I'm not a fan of super sugary drinks, and it's perfectly, mildly sweetened. I always add boba to it as well! Highly recommend. A great place to catch up with friends.
author: Isabella W.

description: Grabbed a coffee to go- tasted great. Loved the inside of the place; very simple and clean. Staff was nice, too. Not many seats, though, if you're planning on sitting down and enjoying a cup of tea/coffee.
author: Rob M.

description: Great local coffee with a very mellow vibe. Tried a pour over and a lot of care went into it. Looks like a very loyal customers from the neighborhood.  Music is just the right volume and the feel of the interior is sleek and clean
author: Chris K.

description: Small coffee shop in Inner Richmond area... and I mean small! Coffee was decent but it's too small of a place to find a spot to sit or have a conversation.
author: Eman D.

description:
Fifty/Fifty is one of the greatest coffee shops in San Francisco, and one of the greatest places I've ever been to. The atmosphere is so calm, bright, beautiful and welcoming, and I feel at home every time I step into the door. The prices are fair and the staff is extremely friendly. I love this place to pieces and come here every chance I get.

At this moment, I've been unemployed since I've graduated college and have taken up residence here as my primary spot for job searching. Looking for work as a fresh college graduate in an industry you have no prior experience is a tough and painful process, and is extremely demoralizing at times. In order to stay motivated, focused, and positive, I need the right cafe that I can come to every day. Over the past five months I've tried multiple cafe's but they all fall short for one reason or another. Starbucks tend to have stressed out staffs, average drinks, and unreliable Internet. Peets is more quaint and personable then Starbucks, but their locations are never really convenient to me. Other cafes tend to focus too much on their food menus and not enough on their drinks, which is all I look for in a cafe'

Fifty/Fifty is perfect in every aforementioned category. The room temperature is right, the Internet is more reliable than my home Xfinity Internet, and the drinks are the gods among coffee shops in SF. I love it here. It's going to be a shame for me when I do get a job and stop coming here regularly in a way because I'll miss seeing my friends here regularly, the friendly and welcoming staff, and the drinks. I hope the business opens multiple locations throughout the Bay Area, and if they decide to do so, they can call me if they need an investor.
author: Tyler W.

description: Quick service & simple menu. Its a little small for big groups, but overall satisfactory 5! Definitely recommend the lavender Earl grey if you're a lavender fan.
author: Angela L.

description: I come here all the time to get an Earl Grey Latte, it's good, better than others in the city. My favorite thing here though is their Matcha Lattes, it's a perfect sweetness, to where I can still taste the matcha, and enjoy my drink. The customer service is good, but I can never find anywhere to sit, it's usually full.
author: Frances B.

description:
Was bummed they didn't have dynamo donuts I saw in the pics, realized now some reviews here say only on the weekends :( :( 

I actually picked the place for that reason :/

But I ended up having a cheese and ham crepe which was very delicious and filling! The matcha hot latte was delicious as well! 

It's smaller than I expected from the pictures. 

Decor is very minimal, simple and very clean. C
author: Katrina M.

description:
Great coffee. Great service. Super efficient!
If you're up on California at CPMC hospital or just shopping don't miss this cafe if you want a real coffee
author: Nicole E.

description:
Fifty/Fifty is a corner café...correction, my new favorite corner café in the Inner Richmond, at least. It's a little far from my house, but the quality of their drinks is kind of worth the trip...

I tried the salted caramel iced tea latte, no boba. It was love from the first sip, but admittedly towards the end it was very watered down....but then again, the last quarter of it sat for nearly 2 hours, so that was my fault. I tried a sip of my friend's peach tea...it was fruity and not too sweet. Very refreshing.

There is free WiFi here, and as such...typically no seats. There are 11 total (5 stools for a bench) and (3) 2 seated tables.
author: Elaine Y.

description: I've been here multiple times here within the past week and all for one reason .. The lavender earl grey latte! I've never had anything like it but the lavender just added such an amazing taste to the earl grey. Warning though, it does come out a little extra hot! Which is amazing for this insanely cold weather but can be bad news for your tongue if your sips are too big! This is my #1 spot when I'm craving for an earl grey latte and for those non-coffee/tea drinkers, try the hot chocolate! I had brought my cousin once for hot chocolate and it's her new go-to spot for drinks!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Awww Fifty/Fifty you are soo freakishly adorable. I love you. You had me SOLD when my order was called and the drink came in a mason jar...A...MASON...JAR... My day was made, and my happiness level soared through the roof. 

We came here to get some studying done, and we were quite productive. There is an ample amount of outlets (at each of the 3 tables, if I remember correctly). There was no line, and the tables weren't filled so there was no issue of getting a seat. I loved the simple decor, and interior design of the place. Ain't nothing better than studying peacefully, with free wi-fi! Service was also fine!

We shared the honey coconut milk tea. DEF RECOMMEND IT!!

Random: The bathroom was super clean too (:
 
Slight irk moment: There was this girl bragging about herself with her friend at the table behind us after about an hour in of studying for us. Her voice was so loud that I could hear every bit of her conversation even if I were put headphones on, tape over my ears, and put earmuffs on.... But that didn't really annoy me - ain't nobody got time for that!

Overall? 5 stars. Would recommend? Yes! (:
author: Lynn L.

description: I ordered a matcha latte and a peppered sausage croissant (it was bomb by the way).  The ambiance of the shop itself is pretty relaxed and simple, but there isn't too much seats inside; thus, I felt even cramped just waiting for my drink. The matcha was good--not too sweet with a hint of bitterness.
author: Song V.

description:
Fifty Fifty is a cute and relaxing corner cafe.

I came here recently and ordered  four drinks (yes... I have a problem). I ordered the salted caramel, matcha, peach and mixed berry drinks all with boba.

The salted caramel was nice and rich while the matcha had lots of sweet green tea flavor. The peach was delicious and the mixed berry was a bit bland.

Definitely gonna try the other items when I'm around.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Saw the great Yelp reviews and decided to stop by with my gfs on a cold rainy day for a cup of hot milk tea. We ordered a large Jasmine milk tea latte, large lavender earl grey latte, a small matcha green tea latte and a bombass toffee choco chip cookie. All the drinks were really good, but less the 2 stars because the idiot barista/tea maker guy. My gf ordered a large drink and he made her a small cup. She told him that she had ordered a large and he looked at her and asked if she wanted him to add more water and sugar. WTF?!!! Didn't apologize, didn't offer to make a new drink or refund the difference for what we paid.  What kind've customer service is that?? I'm pretty sure the owner would not be having that. We were in a rush to get out, so we just took the drink and left.
author: La D.

description: Boba was delicious: firm but not too chewy or grossly soft, right amount of honey flavor - I got the Mixed Fruit (real fruit) Berry drink w/ light sweetness and it was a great refreshing treat. Only con is it's a bit overpriced IMHO (around $4.50 for the smallest size), but I did enjoy it over some of the cheaper options in the area. Would definitely go again if I was close by.
author: Katie H.

description: Talk about finding a gem, this place is THE COOLEST little coffee house in San Francisco
author: Ace M.

description:
When I used to drive by this place at 7 AM and saw lines to the door, I was in awe and disbelief. I thought, "no place can be this good..."

I was wrong.

Being our first time there, we had a few questions. The woman at the front was very patient with our inquiries!

Let's start with the drinks. They have a pretty small menu. I tried the honey coconut milk tea with boba. Mm... so good and creamy! My hubby got the mango tea. It was really fruity and refreshing! 

They only had one serving of boba left, so they split it between our two cups and didn't charge us for it. Awesome!

We got the pistachio cream donut. Wow. Heaven. Pure. Deliciousness.

We haven't even tried the Dynamo donuts yet! Guess we'll just have to come back...
author: Sara K.

description: I loooove coffee so I was happy to find  a new place!!!! But sadly the coffee was too weak!!!  Eventhough that I like mild coffee!!!! But  this one tasted very watery!!!!. Maybe I will give it another try!
author: Cecilia C.

description:
The boba tasted a little over cooked and wasn't chewy but it was sweet. The girl at the counter wasn't too knowledgable about the drinks and kept providing wishy washy answers when I asked which drinks were popular. 

I would recommend the mango green tea they use real fruit and it was refreshing. Didn't have complaints on cleanliness. Would come again
author: Jina Y.

description:
This cute little coffee shop on the corner is very bright, airy, and modern. I was really excited when I first entered seeing that they have Ritual Coffee which is my favorite. But today I was craving a milk tea with tapioca. I found this place on Yelp and this was at the top of the list. 
I ordered the classic black tea latte with tapioca. I couldn't be happier with my drink. The tea is fresh and perfectly sweeten and the tapioca pearls are perfect! I also ordered the pumpkin muffin with cream cheese frosting and again I was pleasantly surprised. The muffin was perfectly pumpkiny (I don't care that it's not a real word) and the cream cheese frost was a perfect pair with the cinnamon and ginger from the the muffin. This combination made for a wonderful fall afternoon snack, which means I'll definitely be back!
author: Reyna C.

description: yummy tapioca! perfect texture to add to your FREAKING DELICIOUS tea latte. the hazelnut hot chocolate is amazing too. just came to visit San Fran for a day on my road trip and I'm glad I found this gem. Lavender + earl grey = happiness in my tummy.
author: Richelle B.

description: Back again from Los Angeles for the best cappuccino and green tea latte in San Francisco : )
author: K C.

description:
I guess I showed up a bit early. I came here looking for these dynamo donuts everyone was talking about, seeing that it's the weekend and they should have them out, but I didn't see any! It's ok, a few minutes later, they came out super fresh. SUPER. FRESH.

I only got the chocolate rose and vanilla bean dynamo donuts because the other few sounded...too exciting for my palate in the morning. They're both so delicious. The chocolate rose looked like it would be overly rich with chocolate, but it actually is very balanced and not too overpowering-just perfect!

I really like the small, quaint space of this cafe, and I'd definitely come back if I were in the area and needed some peace and quiet to get some work done. The staff are very kind and welcoming, too!
author: Bonita K.

description:
The small sparsely decorated operation is long on efficiency and thankfully short on pretension. No, Ivanka and her ilk wouldn't like it here but that is a huge plus. I'll take my macchiato in a paper cup thank you. Please, no need to bust out the porcelain or that cup that was crafted from clay that was sourced on the shady side of a hill overlooking Ulan Bator (damn I miss Mongolia). Seriously I just need a hit. 

 There's three tables and one bar-like counter by the window if you need to drop anchor for a while. I imagine some may want to hide from their HR departments or their accountants. It's a good place to do that. Remember not to check-in and blast your location. Sip on that coffee and chill son. 

Speaking of coffee it's actually good. Nothing superb but not burnt and acrid like some places in the vicinity. I'll try the espresso next time.
author: Jahan T.

description: This coffee place was cute and had a very hipster vibe! Everything was default double shot espresso! (Not sure if it's still like that now).
author: Victoria C.

description: A very quaint, cute corner coffeeshop. Their lavender earl grey tea latte is what i've heard so much about. It's the tops! Flavor is spot on, the ratio of lavender and earl grey is balanced, and the boba is perfection!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Teensy tiny place with a very limited menu. 

Limited menu: I kind of wish they offered more. Only a few coffee options and boba choices. With a few pastries. On the plus size, the iced coffee is super strong. 

Limited seating: there are only 3 small tables and a bar by the window. 

Very clean and modern, but there is room for improvement.
author: Ali B.

description:
Laptop camper here. Fifty/Fifty is a newish coffee and tea place with Ritual coffee and espresso drinks, milk tea (tapioca pearls are extra), green tea fruit purees, and pastries. On weekends they have Dynamo Donuts. There aren't many food options and the menu is brief. The décor also has a spare, minimalist look (but nice) with lots of wood. It's modern but not cozy. 

* Latte ($3.50): quite nice, smooth not bitter at all, simple foam art
* Chocolate Star Anise Dynamo Donut: Moist, dense chocolate cake with lots of chocolate flavor, not as sweet as other donuts, good quality chocolate frosting but didn't notice much star anise

It's a good camping spot though on the small side. There are outlets along the wall, a bathroom, and fast, secure wi-fi. The tapioca pearls are usually cooked around 10 AM or later.

You know you love me. X0 X0, laptop camper.
author: Lolia S.

description: I pretty much go here every weekend. Its a nice coffee shop that also serves boba in the afternoon! Coffee is provided by Ritual and they have pastries and donuts as well (donuts from dynamo). There are a few tables for you to chill and/or do work. Overall good coffee shop and super nice staff.
author: Mike P.

description: I stopped in here one Saturday morning while I was waiting for my guy's to finish my car at the body shop.  It was around 8:00 a.m., and both people working here could care less about customer service.   They were cold, short "what do you want" type demeanor.   The coffee was good, but not where I'd go back (and I do live near here).  It's nice they carry Dynamo Donuts, but again, I don't think I would venture back just because of the customer service.   I also spotted ants along the ledge near the coffee machine while I was waiting on my latte.
author: J B.

description:
F inally a fresh face in this stretch of Dreary... er, Geary
I t's nice to see a business here that's not a hair salon or repair shop
F or starters it has all the essentials:  decent hours, WiFi, and coffee
T he white walls and indie music give an ambiance of a cafe at an art gallery
Y et the vibe isn't stuffy -- the friendly staff help make the place welcoming

F ifty's menu is true to its name -- they serve coffee and tea
I  had the Mango Green Tea Purée drinks as suggested by the owner
F ound it to be very refreshing and loved that they use real fruit
T he latte, made with Ritual coffee, is well-crafted (as my girlfriend can attest to)
Y ou'll love that they serve Dynamo Donuts here, a perfect coffee complement!
author: Anthony N.

description:
50/50 is one of my favorite coffee shops in the city. They serve Ritual beans on a Marzocco. The drinks here are consistently terrific, and there is usually easy parking. 

What else could one ask for?
author: Erik S.

description: This place is a go to cafe for myself because of the light mood and delicious drinks. Their boba is so well made and their food is so great! If you ever need to do some work and be in a quiet environment this is the place to do so. If you ever get something I would recommend the Black Mint Boba and Toffee Chocolate Chip Cookie.
author: Nicholas H.

description: I was visiting Golden Gate Park and yelped local places that made matcha latte. I was excited to try theirs since the picture on their yelp looked sooo good. To say I was disappointed would be an understatement.  When i received the drink it looked so nice considering they made a cute heart design, but when I tasted it went down hill fast. The taste was off and it had the weirdest grassy texture.  I have tasted matcha lattes at many other places and it definitely should not taste like that. Maybe their other items are good, but definitely not their matcha latte.
author: Jessica L.

description: The boba was hyped up way too much. Fifty fifty was recommended to my friend and I so we decided to go there. The environment itself resembled a nice, clean, and hipster coffee shop, which is what they should stick to. COFFEE, NOT BOBA. The boba was hard and disgusting. The tea was watered down and tasted as if it was not brewed but made with water and powder. Really disappointed. Will not be coming back here again.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Good tea is hard to find and this place really nails it. Been here 3 times, the first time I got a hot matcha green milk tea and my boyfriend got the green tea mango puree. The mango puree is the best tea I have ever tasted (and that includes Mr. Green Bubble). The way that it is made really brings out both the tea and mango flavor. The Matcha green milk tea was pretty good as well but the reason we came back was for the green tea fruit puree. 

The second time we came here we got a green tea peach puree and a green tea pina colada fruit puree. We definitely like the peach one a lot better than the pina colada (which we will not be getting again) but it was still not as good as the mango one. 

The third time we got the mango fruit puree and a cold matcha milk tea. Both were delicious. I personally like the matcha cold better than the hot one but either way their tea is very top grade. 

If you're a boba person like me then go after 12 because thats when they finish making their boba/pearl/tapioca. 

Decor-wise, it is very clean and bright. Seating is limited with only 2-3 tables and a small counter looking out the window. 

Service is average: friendly and nice. And they take credit card which is awesome! 

Overall, great place. Definitely check it out if you're in SF even if it's a bit out of your way. If you like REALLY GOOD tea come check this place out. You'll be coming back.
author: Linda N.

description: I didn't really enjoy my green tea latte, I would have liked mine a little bit more sweet. Kind of bitter, but I did enjoy the coffee cake I ordered.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
Got the mango green tea fruit purée and was really pleased. Super refreshing, and you can tell they don't use artificial flavoring. 

Highly recommend it! Definitely will be back to try more drinks.
author: Cassey C.

description: The reviews were good so I tried it and was disappointed. Mostly because they didn't have anything that was advertised and the staff were like zombies who could care less.  For a boutique coffee house I would expect a lot more. Don't see this place sticking around in SF.
author: B F.

description:
Fifty/Fifty is a small hole on the corner of Spruce and Geary, not much space inside, just a few tables and some stool seats by the window. 

the counter has lots of goodies: expresso, milk tea, drip coffee, hot chocolate and various donuts and artisan pastries. .'twas noonish and all the baked goods were gone. (early bird gets the    ?)

pour: drip pour ritual coffee(3)
-bold on the edge coffee for real coffee drinkers.
-worth the 3 minute wait for fresh coffee

drips:
-nice people, nice ambience, nice music
-metered parking nearby.
author: Victor G.

description:
This neighborhood NEEDED a coffee shop like Fifty/Fifty. And I'm glad they're here! 

Can't complain about Ritual coffee, Dynamo donuts, free wifi, friendly staff, and its cute modern lodge-like decor. 

I've had their hot lattes and their iced lattes. Must I add that their ICED LATTES ARE OUT OF THIS WORLD!! Very smooth with a hint of sweetness.. Everything just complements so well with the boldness of the espresso shots.

This place is definitely my go-to spot! 

I've heard alot of good things about their milk teas and their green teas with fruit puree, so I will definitely give 'em a try next time!
author: Nance L.

description: 5 star for coffee and 0 star for service. People are in bad mood and chasing ppl out when they are still 10 mins to close. Being really loud with their cleaning. Not a very pleasant experience, will not be back again.
author: Becky B.

description: We stopped by here because we needed to get change haha. We just ordered a cookie and it was really good. It was really expensive but I'd probably give it another try for their other stuff next time. I'll probably update my review if I go back :)
author: Maggie W.

description:
Nice new coffee house in the area. And they have a Los Gigantes blend - not sure of the flavor, but love the name.

Coffee, tea, milk tea, and green tea fruit puree.

Nice selction of muffins and donuts in the morning.

Run by a very nice couple.

I think Royal Grounds will still be my go-to place inthe hood, but will continue to stop in here on occasion.
author: Jeff H.

description: I've gone back many times since this is the closest and best coffee to where I live. I still don't understand why soy and almond milk are more expensive. It's not just this place--it's almost every cafe. In Portland, all the milk choices are the same. It's not even like soy or almond milk is more expensive than the barista milk they use. Anyways... I still like this place. Today I had the earl gray/lavender latte which is one of my favorite combos. Staff is nice, free wifi but don't always count on a seat!
author: Stella H.

description: The honey coconut latte is yummy and the espresso drinks are great! There aren't enough places in SF that get espresso drinks done right. This place does... The foam, the foam on lattes are perfect. The vibe is very chic, simple and hip. Not a ton of seating, but it's never seems to be too crowded so I always find a seat. I recommend checking out this place!
author: Nisa C.

description: Came here this past weekend and it was nice clean place.  Not many places offer tea lattes, so happy that they offered it here.  I ordered the salted caramel tea latte and it was um.  The young lady at the front was very nice and helpful to explain the different dynamo dounts to us.  We did get one!!  Great spot to hit up.  I want to come back for their puree drinks next.
author: James L.

description: This place can make a gooood capp. Can't wait to go back and try more of their drinks! Stopped by with plans of getting some work done, but all the seats were taken. Understandable as the place isn't huge -- the bright, modern vibe made up for it though. :)
author: Camille L.

description:
Highlights
- It's a cute clean and modern spot. Minimalistic, but a variety of everything from coffee, teas, pastries, and doughnuts to fit everyone's needs. 
- Boba is also offered and they serve Dynamo Doughnuts later in the morning/day! I am already in love with this spot. Thank goodness they are not closer to me or else I would come every weekend. 
- My all time favorite is their peach or mixed berry puree green tea. Both taste so refreshing and there are real bits of fruit shaken in.
- I still need to try their strawberry hot chocolate sometime!
- Not too crowded during my early morning commutes, so I don't have to wait too long. 
- It's a nice quiet place if you need to study especially early in the mornings. 

Improvements
- I tried their coffee and even their coffee/tea blends, but I would prefer their teas over both. 

Tip
-They have frequent buyer stamp cards. Ask for it!
author: Tracy T.

description: Excellent coffee (ritual coffee). Clean space nice employees. The only ding is I felt the pastries were a bit overpriced.
author: Will H.

description: Okay espresso drinks. I would still choose this place over Starbucks though. The shop could use a little cheering up.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
Time for afternoon tea and reading so I stopped by this place for some milk tea.  Sat by the window to read.  it was a great place to people watch off the streets of geary blvd.
Got the coconut honey milk tea, which lacked tea flavor but had a strong coconut flavor..
nice clean place to take a break from things and their music selection is quite good.
author: Linda T.

description:
Small Cafe with 3-4 tables and a few bar seats on the corner of Geary and Spruce with a wider variety of cold and hot drinks.

Matcha Green Tea Latte- Asked for half the sweetness and the drink was great! Made me worried though thinking about how much full sweetness would be. I thought the sweetness with half the sugar was still pretty sweet. I don't like to cut out more than half of the sugar or the flavor changes to drastically from what it was suppose to be. 

Jasmine Tea Latte- Also asked for half the sweetness, unfortunately the flavor wasn't up to my expectations, I could barely taste the Jasmine Tea. What I did taste was milk, water, and sugar. I was excited for this drink because I'm a big fan of jasmine tea.

-1 star to the employees working there at the time for not cleaning up the tables when they were not servicing customers. There are only 3 tables and the patrons were kind enough to put their dishes in the wash bin. All they had to do was come out with a rag and get the coffee stains and pastry crumbs off the table.
author: Michael S.

description:
Super cute little coffee shop in the corner. Hand tapered espresso. Very fairly priced.

DELICIOUS.

Five stars. Will come back again with a buddy
author: Lisa L.

description:
Got a Jasmine Milk Tea with boba here. It isn't really a "boba" spot but you can get tea and coffee and other drinks and add boba. But the atmosphere is more cafe style. They even have desk type seating/tables for the coffee shop loving blogger to sit at and work. It has a really hipster vibe. So maybe boba for hipsters.

The drink was good though. Not great but good. 3 stars for being a bit confusing on the direction they're taking. Not really my scene but I can see what they're going for.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I used to come here a lot with my friends, and I'd make the trek from the Sunset to get their matcha latte.

Today, I came in with my 3 stamp cards. Each with 2, 3, and 6 stamps hoping to redeem my free drink -- 10 stamps are supposed to be redeemed for 1 free drink. I'm guessing the stamp cards are intended to reward repeat customers.  The guy that took my order told me that they don't combine stamp cards because they don't want to encourage customers to keep taking more stamp cards. I guess printing those cards really eats into those margins especially when they are charging $4 per drink. I explained that I forget to bring my card in, and that's why I have multiple cards, but I have a total of 11 stamps. Not only did the cashier/barista refuse to redeem my free drink, he offered to combine 2 of my cards just this one time...this doesn't help...I still need to buy a drink and I'm left with 2 stamp cards to keep in my wallet. Anyways, I politely told him that it wouldn't be necessary because I won't be returning to this cafe. I told him I'd still like to purchase a matcha latte today,but I'll be throwing away my stamp cards.

My opinion: They make great drinks, but their customer service is pretty poor. Try Cumaica a couple blocks away on Clement. Their matcha latte is pretty comparable, and their customer service is pretty good. I don't know if they have a repeat customer reward system, but at least I won't feel like my time has been wasted collecting stamps.
author: Randy T.

description: I live in the Richmond District so this has easily become my go to coffee shop. A friend introduced this place to me not too long ago and I seriously don't know how I didn't know about this place sooner. I'm obsessed with anything that has lavender in it so naturally the first thing I tried here was their Earl Grey Lavender Latte & I've been in love with it ever since. I have also tried the Mixed Berry Green Tea Fruit Puree & I do think that it could be more flavorful. I don't think I'll be falling out of love with the Earl Grey Lavender Latte anytime soon, but I would definitely like to try the other espresso drinks here!
author: Nicole L.

description: Nice, clean, minimalistic atmosphere. Good tasting tea, very chewy tapioca (maybe a tad too chewy?), delicious.
author: Connie S.

description:
Had the salted caramel tea latte with tapioca and I thought it was just average.  

It was pretty light and watery with a faint salted caramel taste. 
Good idea but poor execution.
I wasn't really a fan of the texture of the boba either.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Not much needed to say past the stars. It's a quaint coffee shop on Geary and spruce. The name 50/50 is because the selection of drinks is 50% coffee based and 50% tea based. 

Whether you want a pour over, latte, green tea fruit purée, you will not be disappointed. 
 
It is smaller though so if you plan to come work or study keep in mind your not guaranteed a table. 

Overall: my personal favorite coffee shop, and for about 2 years in a row now, every weekend I get my caffeine fix here.
author: Matthias K.

description:
After coming here a few times to grab coffee/tea lattes/boba to go, I thought that this would be a good place to study. It's quiet, clean, has free wifi... BUT I soon found out that the staff (well one of them in particular) here is completely rude.

It was a typically foggy and windy day in SF. I sat at the table next to the back door. I closed the door because the wind kept blowing my papers and I was freezing!! The Asian woman who works here opened the door. I closed it again. Five minutes later when she opened it again I asked her to please keep it closed this time because I was really cold! She said no sorry it's too hot in here for the workers; this room has no ventilation. Ok I get that. Therefore I asked her if she could prop the front door open instead of the back door? All she said was no. No explanation or anything. Seriously, what kind of customer service is this?? 

While I was sitting here I also overheard another customer order a macchiato that turned out to be way more bitter than she was used to. It didn't even look like she wanted to take another sip. Despite the complaint, they didn't even offer to remake her drink. So inconsiderate. 

Although I may order drinks to go in the future (only because it is the closest cafe to my house), safe to say that I will not be back to study!
author: Heidi Q.

description:
Brand new spot just off Spruce on Geary.  I've been needing a new place to "work from home" and this one seems to take the cake:  Pour-over Ritual coffee, high speed internet, delicious baked goods from Devil's Teeth Bakery and purdy workers = my new office.

If you have the time, stop in.  Support the mom and pop businesses, especially the new ones trying to last.  Lots of parking nearby.
author: Matt H.

description: I love their matcha green tea! They only have boba after 12pm and they run out quickly. They have limited seating but it's a good spot to do some work if you live close-by.
author: Mariana L.

description: LOVE the Macha lattes here!  And the pastries are always fresh and delicious.  My go to is a chocolate croissant to accompany my latte and no one carries flakier and more scrumptious croissants.
author: Nan B.

description:
When looking up places to satisfy your weekly boba cravings (go ahead, it's okay to admit it), this place doesn't immediately pop up on the search engine. They are advertised as more of a tea and coffee place that serves pastries like donuts (also avail in gluten free form) from a donut place called Dynamo.  

For drinks (both ordered less sweet) try the honey coconut for hint of flavor but just enough to satisfy your curiosity and the salted caramel for a richer, slightly sweeter taste.  The tapioca was surprisingly amazing! I only say this because this isn't a "boba spot." The tapioca was the right consistency and sweetness which sadly I can't say for some other boba spots I have tried. So thumbs up for that!
The hostess also recommended the matcha green tea but i'll just have to come back for that one.

They have a variety of donuts available but I opted for just one donut- the apple, maple bacon donut. The name just kinda makes your mouth water already doesn't it? The hostess kindly heated it up for us (super thumbs up!) 

Try this place out, I highly recommend this as a go-to spot for boba drinks in SF. I'm sad I don't live closer to this sweet spot.
author: Sarah N.

description:
Why. Is. Everything. So. Good.
TAKE MY MONEY, TAKE IT ALL!
I'm officially obsessed. Anyone who says this place is anything other than amazeballs can take their poor taste and negative vibes elsewhere cus this place is the shit. A particular fan of the iced latte with (perfectly cooked) boba and their jasmine tea latte, but I don't think it's possible to go wrong here. If it was more socially acceptable, I would come here 3x a day.
Thank you for your delectable services fifty/fifty, expect to see me way too often.
author: Dayna Y.

description: This is my jam!  I love coming here and getting the lavender earl grey tea latte, hot.  I like a lot of their pastries too, the chocolate chip cookie is my favorite.
author: Meredith K.

description:
I can't say enough about how amazing this place is. Im there probably 4 times a week.
Their Chai tea latte is better than Starbucks and now even cheaper (I think fifity/fifty is 3.25, and Sbux is 3.45) Plus it's just made better.
I am a huge fan of their Iced Matcha Green Tea. 
They brew the teas in the morning, so their fresh. And then make the latte with organic nonfat milk. yumm... the jasmine tea is light yet delicious. they have other varieties as well.
The boyfriend loves their pour over drip (I don't do coffee, but he's a snob about it, so I'll trust him)
hey also have a frozen hot chocolate which is amazing!  
The iced tea fruit purees (or something) are delicious - i like the tea with peach - very fragrant and refreshing. 

Oh and the kale scone? Best way to eat poorly while feeling healthy.. "but it's kale...duh" 
Any of the donuts and brioche puffs are fantastic!
Sunny & Van are amazing people and have created quite the fan base. I wish that I could reserve a table every Thursday afternoon, but alas, their popularity gain is my loss (of space..it's small)

Try a bing - it's delicious (crepe with hot sauce and sesame and meat and other goodness... just try it)
And the granola, yogurt parfait with fresh berries, is fantastic. Yes you could make your own at home, but the presentation wouldn't be as nice.
author: owen brenna i.

description: Had the Honey Coconut Tea Latte with tapioca, which was good. Not too sweet for me because I like very sweet most likely. The tapioca had a sweetness to them as well (I hate when boba doesn't taste like anything) and was just the right amount of soft and chewy. I would go back again if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Alicia A.

description: the cold brew coffee is amazing.  Smooth and refreshing on a perfect sunny day in SF.  No need for any milk and sugar either!
author: Kevin W.

description: Love their matcha latte, I can't wait to try their coffee and boba drinks! Friendly, efficient service. Don't forget to pick up their stamp card too!
author: Dan N.

description: I had the lavender earl grey tea, which was amazing. It's just a small shop with not much to look at, but if it were at all convenient for me to do so, I would definitely go again.
author: Marie R.

description:
Stopped by here for a quick drink on a warm weekend. I got their peach green tea which was very refreshing. Their fruit teas have more tea flavor and don't taste that artificially sweet and syrupy. They use a house made fruit marmalade in the drinks so there are real fruit chunks in it to add flavor! There's always extra cream/sugar on the side if you want it to taste more sweet. The girl that helped us was very nice and patient with our questions as well. Overall a very positive experience. 

They have a few tables but they were all taken by people studying/reading. Not really a good place to hangout with a group since there's not a lot of space inside and it seems more like a place where people go to work on their computers.
author: Maryann S.

description: One of my favorite coffee joints. Excellent latte's and clean, modern interior. Friendly staff. It's a must if in the hood.
author: Brooke S.

description:
I have not been disappointed yet. 

You first walk in and notice, yea, it is a little tight. But hey, that's SF for you. Passed all that, I really saw value in their green tea fruit puree. Good quality stuff, though I can see how it can be a little on the sweet side. Remember, always take in moderation. 

What I liked about their puree drinks is that they don't have high volumes of fruit in the cup, so that you get more juice. I'd suggest the mango and strawberry/banana flavors. It's very refreshing and it's hard to put down after just one sip. The donut muffins are pretty killer too. Very innovative idea which seems to work for me. 

The times I've been there, it's usually manned by one woman. She's fast and even during busy times, she seems to hold it down extremely well. Respect! 

I'm real glad it's in close quarters from my internship. Very clean and well-kept. There's a few seats available if in case you choose to park it for a while. 

Overall, they've earned a place in my book.
author: Will S.

description: A hipster coffee joint, with a ton of quality baristas, in the land of powdered boba schlock. In fact, in addition to espresso and pour over, 50/50 has exceptionally high quality boba beverages! Really cute joint, I stop here when I'm in the Richmond.
author: jason c.

description: Decent coffee for a decent price! The place is cute and small, but it would be nice if there were more seating arrangements
author: Alene R.

description:
They should stick to that children's drink with the stupid balls and not attempt coffee. Watery and not hot. It may be Ritual but they need to find someone who knows how to prepare it. Ambiance sucks. No personality.

50/50? More like 50/100... which is an F
author: Chuck G.

description:
Got the pour over. It was super weak and gross. I didn't finish it :(. Lady didn't seemed to pleased about making it either. Maybe her shitty vibes were absorbed by my coffee...I guess that explains why it tasted like shit. 
Could have been a fluke though, I won't find out though cause I'm not willing to try it again.
author: John G.

description:
A recently opened modern coffee and tea shop! I am not a coffee drinker, so I was glad they had a variety of teas to choose from. 

So far I have tried:

-jasmine milk tea
-honey coconut milk tea with boba
-Mixed berry tea
-Oatmeal cookie

And they all were perfect to my taste, not too sweet. But you always have the option to make it sweeter to your taste. And the oatmeal cookie was hella good too! I will definitely come back for the oatmeal cookie & the honey coconut milk tea, my 2 favorites so far :)

A great place to study too, but the space has only a few tables so I would suggest coming early if you are planning to have a good study sesh with good coffee/tea!
author: Jenny P.

description:
This place is amazing. Gluten free vegan tasty treats. Califa Barista almond milk. Matcha. All of my favorite things that I look for in a cafe. Cute, clean, new. The bathroom is always clean. It always has nice indie sounding hipster music in the background and a relaxing atmosphere. The only think is that the space is small. You'll have to squish next to someone on the bar near the front or share an outlet with a stranger at a mini table .Other than that, love love love.

I usually get matcha with almond milk and the gluten free almond torte. One small note. They use simple syrup to sweeten their beverages. I ask them to please hold but go ahead and use the vanilla. It's probably not natural vanilla extract but hey it tastes damn good.
author: Cassandra M.

description: Ah, I love their lavender cappuccino. It's really good. I also tried coconut lemon cake. Yummy!
author: Jasmina T.

description: I really like the aesthetic here- very minimalist and bright. I got an iced matcha latte- it was a bit too sweet for my liking. The service was cordial- I could tell she was a bit shy and didn't mind at all. Good spot for studying if you can find a seat. Not sure about outlet availability- didn't see any. I sat at the bar near the window at the front and had a fine time studying. I came on a Sunday afternoon and parking was very easy and available. The torte looked really good but I was too full from brunch! I'll probably come back just for Ritual coffee and to try the baked goods
author: Kim V.

description:
Visited my sister and she took us here - says it's her favorite place in town and I can see why. Cute coffee shop - very clean and simply decorated inside. Staff was quick and very friendly. 

I got the matcha green milk tea cold and it was heavenly - seriously best I've tasted. I love the bobba! The staff recommended getting it hot too. Fifty/Fifty is definitely going to be a pit-stop when I visit SF next time!
author: Ling C.

description: This clean white - interior little place is becoming more and more popular with locals. Really good baked goods from local boutique bakers. Ritual coffee, which they will sell you from their own inventory if they don't have pre packaged on the shelf. And they really know how to make a cappuccino here. A lot of places are bitter and without finesse. But these people know how to make a cup. A few simple tables inside and a counter with a few chairs are usually full of young people on laptops. Super friendly people behind the counter also. Fast personal service.
author: Kelly P.

description: Great place to pick up a quality breakfast in this area of town!! I enjoyed my donut and tea and was given excellent service! They get crowded and rightfully so! Kudos to a great little restaurant!
author: Sandra P.

description:
Got a Jasmine Tea Latte, which was a little too sweet for my taste, but the flavor was great. It was nice and piping hot, which was perfect because I went on one of the coldest days a while back. 

Parking was easy to find, but place is tiny and easy to miss! Love the aesthetic and clean interior. They have donuts, but I didn't try. Next time! :)
author: Ann L.

description:
Great little coffee shop. I stop by here at least once a week on my breaks from work.

Peach green tea is fantastic!
author: Mike F.

description:
Delicious, simple and just steps away from my front door. If you're a lazy mofo like me, it really does not get any better than that.

The natural light the cafe gets during the day is captivating, but it's the friendliness of the cafe's owners, Sunny and Van, and the deliciousness of their hot milk teas that makes Fifty/Fifty a worthy resident in my heart and neighborhood.
author: Kat N.

description:
Cute, neat, and minimalist store with unknowledgable baristas. I'll give them kindness and patience - but that's about it. They couldn't tell me much about their coffee or tea, aside from reading me the menu out loud.

If you consider Starbucks coffee (now, just essentially the coffee, not the sugar and delicious syrups) below average, then you could call this place near-average. To ensure smoothness, a well-known trick is adding salt to your drink, however, they added a little too much. Drinking a store's first cup of gourmet coffee is about surprising your taste buds with their unique take, but what good is it without subtlety?

However, this place's window seating is very nice, despite the architecture to be inconsistent (certain areas looked impressive, others looked like they ordered cheap contractors and materials). I find it disappointing because the vibe and atmosphere is truly unique, however the coffee, service, and huckleberry donuts could not live up to par. Until next time, fifty/fifty.
author: J J.

description: I'm very surprised by the high rating of this place. The menu is interesting and has so much potential, but every drink I've had here has tasted watered down, including the honey coconut, which I had high hopes for. Unfortunate because the menu seems great. I hope they can work on perfecting their drinks.
author: Janet P.

description:
Came here because it was nearby and heard rave reviews for the Honey Coconut Milk Tea with Tapioca.

Sadly to say, the milk tea was a disappointment. It was bland, watered down and fell short of flavor. I really wanted to like this place because it's so close to me but IMO the milk tea was not good. I rather trek my way to the richmond/sunset for real boba drinks. But -- fifty/fifty deserves a star for trying! I'd definitely like to come back for the coffee and donuts.
author: Julia K.

description:
Ritual coffee and Dynamo donuts.  What more could a girl want?

Good place to read a book, as well as catch up with a friend.
author: EY L.

description:
DRANK:
1.) Latte = o man they make it good. And strong. Mmmm. Love it.


SERVICE:
Nice.


ATMOSPHERe:
Cute small cafe, simple minimal. Not enough space if I actually want to bring work to do.

11/3/13
author: Angela L.

description:
****4****Star  quality tapioca beverage.

No tapioca before noon without signage: ***3*** Stars

When did tapioca drinks move to the "No lunch served before noon" menu?!?
author: Eric J.

description:
I ordered honey coconut milk tea with boba. It was good.. Not bad, not super delicious.
I forgot to ask them about sweetness so it was no sweet at all... I came back and ask them about sugar or something and she just added more syrup... And told me at the next time let them know before... Hmmmm.. Ok.
But I don't think about next time at all.. 
I guess it was my first and last time there.
author: Anastasia G.

description: Great chai tea latte. Love that they brew their own chai, so the sweetness level can be adjusted. A little over the top to charge an additional dollar for almond milk. I'd come back if I was in the area.
author: Janelle F.

description:
I've been wanting to try Fifty/Fifty since it first opened. I love the idea of a more upscale coffee and milk tea cafe with dynamo donuts. 

The cafe is very bright white with minimalist decor. By the time we got there at 6pm, they had run out of boba which was a little disappointing. We had matcha milk tea and jasmine milk tea. Neither of them was anything special. Both of them had too much milk and not enough tea flavor. $3.25 for a drink without boba also seemed a little bit expensive to me. 

The sign says they use Clover milk. I believe Clover is an organic dairy farm in Petaluma, so it's nice that they use local products. I'll come back again to try their ritual coffee and donuts, but I think I will pass on the milk teas.
author: Vanessa C.

description: I stopped in SF for work/vacay and was really impressed by this cute little coffee shop. It's clean, modern, and has a European feel to it with the outside seating. I enjoyed many macchiatos for the week that I was there and even was lucky enough to try a chocolate donut! Every bit was delicious. Highly recommend!
author: Samantha L.

description: The coffee is good, but if you like cute asian girls that act clinically depressed 24/7 then this is your place. The girls here have a serious problem with customer service, they appear to be making an attempt at post punk angst but just can't pull it off, punk is dead baby, take a Xanax. At least the coffee is good I guess. Also a lot of USF undergrads here and you can't help overhear their high school level of communication "oh my god, like, hella, like sooo ummmm, like, hella, like..." $150K well spent.
author: Erin T.

description:
This place is really cute and the staff is very helpful. Unfortunately, I'm not a fan of the donuts. Although the flavor options are interesting and unique, they didn't taste that great to me. I ordered the coconut donut (I love coconut) and it was really dry and flavorless. My friend enjoyed their donuts however.

I do recommend their milk teas and coffee however. The green tea milk tea was awesome!
author: Andy K.

description:
One of my favorite neighborhood and San Francisco treats. Incredible kind and gracious staff, the owners pride themselves in top service and quality and I hope they never leave the corner of Spruce! 
The Blended Hot Chocolate with 2 pumps of Hazelnut is delicious! I also recommend their pastries- a yummy delight!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
I like this place. The owners are totally sweet people. I live in the neighborhood and frequent this coffee shop often. They make a great latte and the pastries are always super tasty. I like the ambiance of the place and the smallness. Sometimes coffee shops just over do it, but this place does it right. I like to sparse menu, means they are focused on doing things right versus doing it all. 

As for the negative reviews of this place, i don't get them. They just sound like snarky people who want everything served to them on a golden platter with rose petals. 

hope y'all can enjoy this place.
author: Bowen P.

description: Lavender Earl Grey tea latte is everything to me. I went with a friend and we showed up before they even opened (I wanted to walk off a decent hangover) and they were super accommodating and sweet about it even though they were obviously also half awake. 10/10 going back for that latte. I think I had a croissant too and it was dank.
author: Molly O.

description: Looking for great coffee or tea? This is the place to go! Friendly staff and best pastries! Tasty donuts, scones, muffins! My favorite is the matcha milk tea and apple cinnamon muffin. The gluten-free carrot cake donut is also quite good.
author: Lisa C.

description: I'm glad I FINALLY tried this cafe. I recently ordered their coconut latte and it was heavenly. I've also ordered their green tea matcha latte because of the yelp raves but I wasn't thrilled. It was too chalky and bitter tasting for me, I was expecting it to be creamier and smoother. That said, the service is always quick and then entire establishment is very clean and cheerful!
author: Laura C.

description:
Terrible. Have been here twice, thinking perhaps the first time was an "off day". 
I need not have given it a second try. 
Each time they did not have the advertised Dynamo donuts. Also -- HOW crummy is this - no SOY Milk.  They had to go in the back to retrieve "Lite" Soy Milk.  On top of that, when I remarked that as a Coffee Shop they should have the core items that one would expect to find in a coffee shop, the owner became aggressive and very rude.
Forget this place if you want a cup of coffee, with soy milk and maybe a donut. You'll apparently never get that here.
author: Jean L.

description: I LOVE this little coffee/tea spot! Sonny and Van (the owners) are absolutely amazing and they really love getting to know their customers. I usually go for a tea latte. I can't pick a favorite because I love them all. They also serve great pastries from shops around the city and can also add boba to your drink. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves tea lattes!
author: Jen I.

description:
I think I've tried 3/4 of all their drinks on the menu and I like them all.  They use ritual coffee and know how to do the slow drip RIGHT.  

Also pretty cool that they make milk tea to order by the cup, and it's really good too.  I'm a fan of their honey coconut for something a little different.  I also really enjoy their tea purees - the mango one is where it's at!  Be careful if you order the berry ones because they have a ton of seeds... since you know, berries have seeds and they use real fruit in their purees.  

They have very limited seating in there, so not guaranteed that you'll find a spot to work.  But the owners are really friendly and nice.  And they have a stamp card!  Perfect because I'm a caffeine addict! :)
author: Anna T.

description: Honestly, the fruit puree and milk teas are pretty watered down. but that's how i like them so that's great. BUT THE SERVICE IS TERRIBLE. like would it kill you to smile? or maybe just don't rush me or cut me off while i'm trying to order?
author: S S.

description: Small, clean, and cozy cafe. It can get loud at times due to its great foot traffic. I was lucky to go there earlier in the morning to secure a good seat. Their latte was wonderful. Their hazelnut hot chocolate is good, too. Next time, I want to try their earl grey milk tea. Their simple interior design really pleases me from benches to the cupboard.
author: Summer K.

description:
Elaine Y. basically took the words out of my mouth. New favorite corner café.

As someone who lives just a block from Velo Rouge, the fact that I'm willing to walk ten times as far to go to Fifty/Fifty says a lot. I love Velo Rouge, but sometimes a girl gets tired of Blue Bottle. There. I said it.

Fifty/Fifty serves Ritual coffee, and the people who work there are so nice that they make me want to cry out of happiness/relief. It's really fascinating that it's actually possible to be a friendly, charming person AND make a delicious cappuccino. I thought that you had to be rude/aloof/busy-reading-pretentious-literature-behind-the-counter to even stand within five feet of an espresso machine. I was wrong.

I'm also delighted because they have matcha lattes. I used to depend on Flywheel on Stanyan for that business, but eventually they took it off their menu and disappointed me forever. Fifty/Fifty has them, so my life is beginning to get back on track.

Also... They sell Dynamo Donuts. These donuts have gone from being a biannual treat to a weekly one. On second thought, maybe that's a bad thing...?

AND you get all of this in a bright, clean space that's attractive without being overwrought or super trendy. Just comfortable and lovely.
author: Jenny M.

description:
5 stars all the way! 

This coffee shop just opened so I decided to give it a try. The coffee has really good quality and they have maple bacon donuts! Surprisingly really good. The staff/owners are really helpful when I couldn't decide what I wanted to try and they gave me a lot of good recommendations. I definitely recommend for everyone to give it a try especially if they're in the neighborhood.
author: Valerie T.

description: Cute local spot making some of the best coffee in SF! And try the croissants, they are all amazing.
author: Ajj J.

description: Nice area and nice workers! Their products speak for themselves. If you're a coconut lover, the honey coconut is a must try. The flavors are instantaneously noticeable after your first sip and if tapioca is added.. the consistency and texture is just perfect. Overall a clean, chill and relaxed little café.
author: Nikole D.

description: Fifty/Fifty is my favorite for boba drinks in the city. They're not a boba shop, but they know what they're doing. Similarly to Boba Guys and Asha in Berkeley, it's as good as it gets in terms of quality and taste. My favorites are matcha and jasmine milk teas with almond milk, lightly sweetened. The honey coconut is also a favorite amongst my friends. Oh and a tip, the boba isn't ready until noon everyday.
author: Melanie N.

description:
Good odds.

Odds are you'll like the meticulous pour over coffee, large windows looking out onto Geary, clean wood aesthetic, friendly staff and free WiFi.

Even greater odds you'll like the Ritual blends such as the Guatemalan Soledad with hints of orange, honey and pear. Same with the strawberry banana green tea fruit puree.

Only thing not in your favor are the odds you'll find a seat. It's small and popular.

But at Fifty/Fifty that's a game of chance well worth taking.
author: Jason B.

description:
Fifty/Fifty is well worth a visit if you're in the USF/Lone Mountain Area. The set up and ambiance is very minimalist, but still warm and inviting (ironic, right?). Staff are extremely friendly and take great care to craft your drinks to perfection. They also boast an offering of Dynamo Donuts - which I have yet to try!

Drinks:
- Matcha/Jasmine Milk Tea: very yummy! Love that they make boba drinks to order rather than prepping in bulk. Tastes fresh and a lot less sugary than most places. The flavors are light and perfectly balanced!
- Soy Latte: Meh. Not my favorite, but will give it another try soon. :)

Overall, Fifty/Fifty is cozy, cute, and not to mention extremely convenient! Hoping to make more visits here soon! If you haven't stopped by already, you definitely should. A neighborhood gem not to be missed.
author: Nicole I.

description: Love their iced boba tea drinks. The matcha one with almond milk is my new favorite! I just wish they weren't so stingy with their rewards cards or they should computerized it because sometimes you just forget to bring the card!
author: annie n.

description: I'm very picky when it comes to coffee shops. They need to have good food and bevrages, free wifi and an atmosphere where I feel that I can work without getting disturbed by my surroundings or hurried to leave by the staff once I finish my drink. fifty/fifty have all of those things, and it's close to my school, so it's a great place to stop between classes. The couple who owns it are super nice too! I don't drink coffee, but I have tried and recommend the milk tea and the green tea peach puree.
author: Vilde E.

description: Fifty/Fifty is a really cute, small tea spot that is really easy to miss if you don't know where it is. Two of my friends actually recommended the place to me so I decided to venture out to inner Richmond to try it out. I got mango green tea and I loved it. I'm used to places making mixed fruit drinks extremely sweet but Fifty/Fifty's mix was just right. I could see this place as a good spot to work out of the office as Fifty/Fifty is an entire magnitude more quiet than your average Starbucks. Tip for the owners: smile more, will help customers feel more welcomed :)
author: Austin W.

description: Just had a wonderful experience at Cherry. I came in early on a Saturday morning and it was relaxing and quiet. My hair looks polished and bouncy - perfect for the wedding that I'm attending later today. I will definitely be back!
author: Ashley B.

description: Just simply amazing!  The Honey coconut iced latte was perfect.  My girlfriend and I had to come back a second time on the same day.  She got the Mango puree was perfectly balanced and refreshing.  I cant wait to come back again!
author: Chris P.

description: Their jasmine tea latte with tapioca with will take you to another cosmic universe and back
author: Autra N.

description:
One of my new favorite places to inhabit when reading needs to be done or a paper is calling my name.

Craving Ritual coffee, Dynamo donuts, or milk tea? It's all HERE! I love the matcha milk tea because it's created with care and attention to flavor. Coffee is great as well!

I really like the people working here because they are so friendly and attentive. :)

Words of wisdom: it's not the biggest coffee shop on the block so come early to grab a seat for those intensive studying sessions!

Place is packed but need a seat? I'll share my table with you :)
author: Christine L.

description: Great little coffee shop. Friendly, but not overly so, staff. The chai was on point! Perfect for Sunday morning.
author: Zachary D.

description:
Great boba tea: not too sweet and fresh, without nasty chemicals and added sugar.

Cons: People hog the tables with their laptops long after their coffee is done
author: Katie K.

description: Skip the tea places on Clement and head here! Some of the boba available in SF - or anywhere - and comparable to Boba Guys in the Mission. I love that the drinks are always perfectly balanced and never overly sweet. Hot or cold, coffee or tea - this place is ace!
author: Kay A.

description:
So far I've only had their coffee, not the tea, so I can't speak to that. I do like that they offer milk tea, though!

Ritual coffee, yes please! Dynamo donuts? Check! Baked good from Devil's Teeth? Check! 

It's a bit pricey, but I think it's worth it. Great corner spot right across the 38 bus stop, on a street that has a traffic signal so you don't to stare down traffic to get to it.

I also appreciate the clean, simple, well-lit aesthetic this place has!

Most importantly - there are great people running the place! Sunny and Van are always friendly; way nicer than the often grumpy people working at Royal Ground.
author: Winston P.

description:
This little coffee shop is a great addition to the neighborhood. Their coffee is excellent, and each cup is made to order.

The decor is clean and minimal which makes for a great clear-headed environment for studying or working. Free wifi, cool music, friendly service, killer coffee. What's not to love?
author: Sabrina V.

description: Got the coconut tea latte and was super sweet. Good, but too sweet for me. Overall, a nice gem in an otherwise strange stretch of Geary.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I just walked my butt from 12th Ave b/c I vaguely remembered spying a cute new cafe on my morning commute, but couldn't remember which street it was... "Passing Arguello? Hm.. Was it a different bus route? Maybe I should turn around and go to one of the lame cafes closer to home.." YAY good thing I kept going. It's at Spruce/Geary. 

All I want from a cafe are an outlet, wifi, caffeine, and natural sunlight. Fifty/fifty offers the bonus of Dynamo doughnuts and/or Devil's Teeth pastries, Ritual coffee, and super friendly service. I found my new go-to cafe! (Also, this honey coconut milk tea is a delight.)

I'm actually already regretting posting up about how much I like this place because I don't want it to become crowded. But I love supporting small businesses, so please do stop in if you are in the area.
author: Nora K.

description:
I actually really like this place. I like the whole simple look and feel. The simplicity. I also like that it's never crowded, like Starbucks. I also don't stink of coffee when I leave. The organic jasmine green hot tea is my jam. I'm pretty low maintenance. 

Maybe when the Richmond gets super hot one day, I'll venture from hot beverages to the green tea fruit purée I keep eyeballing. One day...
author: Denise H.

description: This place has a cute atmosphere but I was not impressed. They no longer make the blended strawberry white mocha that I wanted to try (bummer!) So I opted for the iced honey coconut latte with soy. It was watery, not flavorful or worth $4.25! And if you're looking to come here to study, you'll be fighting with other people for three tiny tables or the window counter. This place is totally overrated and I was disappointed!
author: Kaila Y.

description: I am very displeased. As I am sipping this awfully watered down milk tea, I am wondering how a place that sells milk tea simply run out of boba. Very displeased.
author: Terrance Z.

description:
Fifty / Fifty Coffee and Tea is located on the corner. Kind of hard to spot on the sidewalk. Inside has a nice wood table thing going and there's quite a few people sitting around with laptops. I didn't ask but from what I see that sounds like there's free wifi there. 

== Drinks ==

Coffee. Latte. Delicious. This place makes a good cup of coffee. Right amount of milk and coffee ratio.

Milk tea. Green. Jasmine. Tastes more like tea than milk. Imagine a tea with a hint of milk instead of milk with the aftertaste of tea. It's different and weird, but not in a bad way. Jury's still out on this, but I didn't hate it.

They sell some pastries that look pretty delicious. Dynamo donuts and Devil's teeth bakery if I'm remembering correctly. Delicious pastries.

== Service == 

Awesome service! Really kind people who were really patient with me who couldn't decide on what to order. 

== Overall ==

Nice little shop to sit down and relax. Milk tea is really different from what I'm used to, but I didn't hate it. The coffee was goooood.
author: Steven B.
