description: One of my favorite cafes in the city. The owners are really nice and always helpful. They have very high quality coffee and the pastries are delicious. The vibe of the cafe is sleek, modern and clean. It's a great spot to study or get some work done.
author: Kourosh Z.

description: This place is a block from my friends so I tried it. Cute little shop w friendly baristas. I got the lavender latte and banana bread, both delicious.
author: Erin M.

description:
i'll admit - i'm a huge coffee snob with the high standards. i've worked in the industry for years and have seen the good, the bad, and the ugly. but fifty/fifty is great!!

their lattes are perfect. i never need to add anything to it to make it tolerable. their microfoam is always silky with hardly any air bubbles and they even add a nice little heart for you at the top!
author: Gories K.

description:
Laurel Heights/USF/Geary hood has needed a good coffee shop for awhile. Nani's was always great service, especially with John(RIP) at the helm, but the coffee was never great. That coffee/sandwich shop at Geary and Cook has some weird mgmt. And the Brazilian place

Fifty/Fifty serves really good Ritual Coffee and the people running the place are really nice. I think the seating/decor could use a little love, but overall I think it's a great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Jamie M.

description:
Love Fifty / Fifty! Cute spot on Spruce/Geary that this part of the city desperately needed! With The Corner Store opening and now Fifty/Fifty, there is hope yet for the Lone Mountain/USF 'hood. 
Coffee is delicious...carefully crafted and great-tasting. The owners are friendly and really take an interest in getting to know their locals.
author: Kirsten B.

description: Honey coconut latte was delicious!!  I liked that it wasn't overly sweet and had the perfect blend of coconut and honey. When I came here people were mostly studying and there weren't many available seats.
author: Emily C.

description:
What a cute coffee shop! Nicely situated on the corner of Geary and Spruce, this shop is simple, happy, and bright. I really enjoyed the white interior and light-colored furnishing. My gripe with coffee shops is that most of the time they're a bit like caves: dark, full of hunched creatures (over laptops and books), stuffy, with smells wafting in the air (all sorts of coffee smells everywhere). Which isn't bad, but it's nice to have a change of setting and work in a light, spacious venue. It's very quiet, so it's a great place to get some work done. Nice window seating if you like thinking out the window and watching the cars go by.

As for the drinks, I've only had their teas--they are pleasantly delicious! The milk teas and flavored green teas I've tried have been perfect. Just sweet enough, bits of fruit in the fruit teas, awesomely balanced milk teas. My favorites so far are the Honey Coconut Tea and Mango Green Tea. Haven't tried their boba yet (gasp) but I'll definitely be back to do so.
author: Emmeline A.

description:
I still remember the first time I went to this corner coffee shop. simple decoration and menu on the wall, very clear and easy to get idea for what you want.
I ordered two mocha, the barista made two different mocha art. very neat and made me really happy. even I just ask for to-go. I certainly remember that place.
author: Blair Z.

description: I came here in the morning. The coffee is good but the service mind of staff is unfriendly at all. She is not ready to work! Seem like somebody force her to work here. She ruined my nice morning...!
author: Choltichakorn S.

description: I love this place. The owners and staff are really kind. Their coffee (from Ritual) is great and their boba tea lattes are addicting!
author: Simone L.

description: This is a perfect neighborhood cafe. Cute, small, minimalist, nice staff and great coffee. It's very clean inside and they use organic milk, which is awesome!
author: N N.

description: They have fantastic coffee, a wide variety of gluten-free baked goods and the crepes look delicious! The staff is very pleasant.
author: Perri B.

description: I stumbled upon this place while running errands with my mom.  And to my delight they served ritual!  The barista was really nice and even made my au lait fresh as a drip coffee as opposed to just pouring from a previously brewed pot. I do wish the space was a little bigger (only 3 small tables inside). I love the all white walls and clean aesthetic! It would've been a really nice place to study!
author: Alli W.

description: Sea salt caramel milk tea. It will change your taste buds. Totally addicting.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Best almond milk latte in town.

Also amazingly kind to rush order and beat my 3 minute window of opportunity before the bus came. Thanks ladies!
author: Sarah G.

description: Precious little gem. Love their coffee. Small and quaint nice little character to the place. My neighborhood coffee spot. They have Dynamo donuts if you're a fan, I don't fancy in particular...the flavors however are unique.
author: Je M.

description:
I ordered the Honey Coconut Milk Tea with boba. It was delicious. The honey coconut flavor was light, but present. The tea was a good strength - not too light, not too strong. The boba was sweet and chewy. 

They use Ritual coffee and Clover milk. The store is minimistically decorated with only about 10 seats, but it seemed like the majority of people were taking drinks to go so that wasn't a problem. 

I wish this place was open later. It would've been a great late-night-coffee-catch-up location.

One thing I wasn't too fond of - one of the store employees appeared to be on her phone for about an hour. At one point she was video chatting and turned the camera towards the customers. That was a little weird.
author: Christy Y.

description:
This review is based on service and atmosphere.

I went to UPS and needed some tea to fix a bad start to this morning. I was happy I stopped by because I'd definately visit again.

The atmosphere was open and inviting. Felt cozy and warm. I just really wanted to sit down, eat a donut and drink one of those blended drinks with a good book or get some studying done there. The people there was helpful and sweet. I didnt notice all the interesting drinks they have here like strawberry and hazelnut blended hot chocolate and I didnt see the donuts but I must try them next time I stop by.
author: Katherine L.

description: Amazing boba! I love the honey coconut milk tea (cold) and my husband loves the jasmine milk tea which is a little less sweet. Having Devils Teeth pastries is also a plus!
author: Lauren S.

description: 50/50 has never disappointed when it comes to making great coffee drinks. The lattes are my favourite,they also make refreshing iced drinks. The staff and owners are very nice people
author: MU T.

description:
This is the cutest little coffee/tea spot! 
Recently opened, so I came here to try it a couple times & I liked what I tasted! 

Their tea and flavoring was very unique and different, unlike the other franchise tea businesses like quicklys. There is quality in every cup and you can actually taste it. The workers were very nice, helpful, & knew what they were doing. I'll definitely be back for more!
author: Jane N.

description:
13.03.23     First Visit - Rough Review - Scouting run

Food                 4 stars   for now ... need more tryouts
                           dropped in just before 7pm
                            food sold out ... drinks only

They offer drinks in following categories:
       Coffee
       Milk Tea
       Green Tea & Fruit Puree
       others   (6 items)

Had the green tea w/ mango puree:
      - both tea and mango were overwhelmed
      - actually liked it ... most places lack in mango flavor or 
                    tasted artificial ... not this place

PRO     
        Finally a nice bright interior place
        Bright furniture ... more cleaner
        well made drink ... only tasted one for now
        Good strong wife

CON
        Need more tables when it picks up
        Outdoor table  or seating will be cool 


more to come

ROUGH DRAFT
author: S.K. Y.

description:
I'm so happy that Fifty / Fifty moved into the neighborhood. We needed a coffee shop: serving great drinks / snacks, with a wide range hours, and with wifi. I've been here many times, and I've always really enjoyed what I ordered.

The interior is a mix of sit down tables / chairs and some window-facing stools - all with ample power outlets if you're into that kind of thing.

The owners / operators of the place are really sweet too and always really helpful and attentive. If you're looking to grab a tasty beverage for the road, or somewhere to grab a drink with friends, it's a great spot.
author: Nick P.

description:
This place is great. The coffee is very well prepared and they use Ritual beans. The purring over method of making coffee is simple and yet many places don't do it right. Here they make it spot on.
They take the time ( you can't rush it) and they serve the coffee in the perfect temperature: warm enough and yet you don't get a burnt flavor.
This place is quiet and no punk-hipster music will drill into your head. Perfect for reading or working. Thank you!
author: Ariel G.

description: Such a cute little place! I loved the green tea peach puree and their boba is so good :)
author: Koki I.

description: Incredible. Incredible coffee! Crafted by people who genuinely care how your coffee turns out. No brainer, when your a No brainer in the morning.
author: Jeff F.

description: Very good coffee (Ritual).  Excellent but small selection of  scones/ muffins etc. Clean bathroom,  good light. nice baristas   A liittle on the small side with only three tidy tables and a bar with stools at the window 4.5 stars
author: W M.

description: The green tea fruit purées make my day. Period.
author: Tiffany D.

description: This place is so cute and Sunny and Van are so nice! I recommend the ice blended chocolate!
author: Nico S.

description: Went in because they sell boba tapioca drinks. I love fruit blends with boba on the bottom. My drink was bitter tea with a little strawberry purée stirred in and boba on the bottom. Totally unsatisfied.
author: Foodie F.

description: They have now added crepes and a breakfast parfait to their menu. They serve cold brew. And the right time to get Dynamo Donuts is on Saturday and Sunday mornings.
author: Tatyana K.

description: We had a jasmine latte asking to have half of the usual amount of sugar. Still it came out like syrup water. The barista girl was not friendly at all. The drink is bad, the service is cold. With all the good reviews on yelp, we might just came in to this cafe at the wrong time.
author: ivy h.

description: This place definitely fits the vibe of SF. I got their strawberry banana green tea blend. I didn't read the green tea part when I ordered and was surprised by the bitterness in the drink. I was expecting a fresh blend! I'm not a huge tea person so the flavor definitely threw me off. It's a small, basic place and not great for crowds. The average reviews speaks more volume than my review since I didn't try their coffee.
author: Megan L.

description: The tea combinations and the option for Boba...'NUFF SAID....this place is a must go if you are ever strolling down Geary. Can't wait to live a block away.
author: Lindsey M.

description: Love stopping by this place on my way to work. Awesome lattes. Great airy bright atmosphere.
author: Sierra M.

description: Convenient corner coffee shop on Geary.  It was a great find I came  across while searching yelp for a new caffeine fix. They serve Ritual coffee and offer fun tea lattes such as salted caramel or honey. On weekends they have offer the much acclaimed Dynamo Donuts without the hassle of driving to the mission and waiting in line. The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is quiet. They have a beverage punch card to reward your loyalty.
author: Victoria O.

description: The latte had very little foam, but the matcha latte was great.
author: Amin S.

description: It is so cute here so minimalistic! I ordered matcha milk tea it was good and the tapioca is homemade. I can taste the sesame in it!
author: Megan L.

description: First of all they're coffee is great. No doubt about it--but they really could take some lessons in customer service and social skills.  I've been here more than 4 different times. I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt, maybe it's too early, etc. but give me a break-if you're going to open up early...1. Have your pastries and such ready for your customers. Every time I've come early, they are putting it out and NOT ONCE, did they even offer any of their goods; 2. RUDE, NO PERSONALITY--Again, I thought, okay, maybe they had a bad day but every single time I've come, I've tried to be pleasant and such and NOTHING, no smile, no greeting--NOTHING. You can have the greatest products but when you have a bad, and seriously--unpleasant attitude, I rather take my business elsewhere. I ran into a friend who frequents the place and she said she finally stopped going. Same experience and I do agree with others who have experienced the same "coldness" of the owners/management--whoever they are. Again, it's a cute place, clean, great coffee, great donuts and pastries but they can keep it. Too bad. It really doesn't hurt or take that much effort to say "Good Morning and/or Thank You" when you are working with the public, especially your own business.
author: Rose S.

description: So i tried the dry chicken and it was pretty good. I'd say in terms of flavor, san tung wins. But what i do like about the chicken here is that the sauce isn't as thick so it doesn't harden after a bit like santung's, and you can keep adding more! Also tried the dan dan mein and that wasn't incredible or anything but still tastey! Super clean inside too (:
author: Holly P.

description:
It's about time our side of town has been smiled upon by the coffee gods. A solid cup of joe in a modern coffee shop . I'm so glad they picked that location in an otherwise easy to drive by part of Geary. 

I've had their drip, it's great. The hazelnut latte is also worth the visit and yes, they have dynamo donuts on the weekends!  I'll have to give the milk tea a try next.
author: Armando A.

description: great place for a simple stop. nothing spectacular, just a selection of simple sandwiches and coffee/tea options. however, the facility isn't the cleanest. costumer service was delightful(:
author: Taylor A.

description: Small, yet on point. I always get an almond milk mocha, easy on the chocolate. The drink is perfect- great temperature, rich espresso taste, and perfect lil foaminess on top. I'm already trying to make this my daily morning stop. Service is also attentive-  the owner asked mid-way through my drink 'let me know if you have enough chocolate in your drink.'
author: Kim S.

description: I work in the area so I have been here several times. Today was the last time. The pastries are expensive and the service is unfriendly. After they run my credit card they never say thank you, they just turn there back and walk away...very strange way to treat a returning customer.  Fortunately I will no longer be returning.
author: Sarah a.

description: I got the iced jasmine tea latte which essentially tastes like jasmine milk tea. The flavor was nice and light and the boba is very similar to the boba at Boba Guys. The staff seemed to know their menu pretty well and were very polite. The only thing keeping this review from 5 stars is that I asked for light ice and light boba my drink had neither light ice or light boba. Other than that definitely coming back!
author: Rachel W.

description: Great quiet little coffee shop. Found by happy accident while waiting on my car getting work done.  Staff is very polite and warm, coffee is spot on, pastries are delicious.  Overall, this place hit the spot!
author: Chelsea D.

description: Not to hate, but I dont really get all the great reviews. I have tried this place twice now and left unimpressed. The donuts were really good (didnt have any the first time i went there), but the service leaves you not really wanting to go back. Maybe because I'm not a "regular"? But why become a regular if you don't feel welcomed. I doubt I will give it a 3rd try
author: Tyler L.

description: Great local place for coffee and pastries. Attention to detail and polite staff. Nice pastries by Dynamo Donuts and Mr Holmes Bakehouse.
author: Brent T.

description: The hot chocolate is great.  Not too sweet and the foaming technique is spot on.  Well done team.
author: Koalie W.

description:
LOVE their HONEY COCONUT milk tea, it's one of the best!!
Plus service is great :)
author: L S.

description: Ritual coffee ... The lattes are amazing. The foam is too perfect. Hands down, best coffee shop in the Richmond district. Super friendly staff.
author: Rob L.

description: The mango green tea is delicious. I love the extra effort they put into making the drink. The tea and ice is shaken in shaker prior to putting it into the cup. When they notice that they couldn't put all the drink in, they would slowly remove some ice in order to fit all the drink. That way you get a cold drink with minimal ice unlike most places which gives you a quarter cup worth of ice. Would definitely come back for more.
author: Audrey M.

description: Best coffee spot on Geary. Cool design and amazing drinks (tea lattes, boba, fruit purees!!). But they also rock the classics: enjoyed a perfectly executed espresso. I'll be back!
author: A G.

description:
Had their drip coffee this morning which tasted more like water with a hint of coffee.  Three dollars for this???  I'm a fan of drip coffee or better said, a good cup of coffee but I can't justify spending $3 for what I received at fifty/fifty.  I really wanted to like this place since I live so near by but I think they are trying a little too hard to jump on the hipster industrial coffee joint.  1. Decorate the coffee shop with old industrial pipes and reclaimed wood. Check. 2. Stamp your pure white coffee cups with a cute logo. Check. 3. Charge customers $$$ for mediocre cup of coffee. Check.
To their defense, i did not try their tea since that is the other fifty.  Hope this helps.
author: Kristina H.

description: I'm in love with this place! I've been several times now and I'm a big fan of not only their coffee but also their pastries. Fifty/Fifty gets their pastries from several famous bakeries in the city, one being Devils Teeth which makes the most amazing scones I've ever had. The baristas here make an excellent cup of coffee each time whether it's an Americano or a regular cup of coffee. I've never heard the sad sound of the coffee grinder relentlessness grinding away here. No, they only grind for each cup and customer so the beans taste fresh and never stale.
author: Ericka A.

description: Nice little coffeehouse and you could even add bubbles (tapioca) to your drink! Oh yeahhh!!! Anyhow, all I'm trying is the matcha latte with bubbles, its tastes decent, maybe a little more sugar syrup to kick it up a notch. Nice and quiet corner where you could hopefully find a table of the three to nerd away. Would definitely come back if I've got examinations coming up!
author: Ann Hui Y.

description: I was just walking by and noticed Fifty Fifty Coffee. They make an amazing cappuccino, if you enjoy a coffee you should totally stop by!
author: Nolan E.

description: High end, creative boba! Love it! Had the chai- it was excellent. Fresh fruit concoctions for the kids. Can't wait to come back.
author: Jammy M.

description: Cool new coffee/tea spot in the neighborhood. They serve Ritual coffee and have tasty treats from Devil's Teeth Bakery.
author: Dilly M.

description: Had the pour over drip coffee. Great flavor, not bitter at all. Very modern decor inside, and nice music playing. Service is friendly and quick. I plan on making this a stop off when I don't want to make coffee at home.
author: John R.

description: This place is awesome.  Quaint coffee shop with good, high quality coffee.  Their boba is superb too, doesn't taste anything like that powdery stuff you get from Quickly.
author: Alex G.

description: Super cute shop, minimalist and clean. I was excited at what things this cute place would offer but the jasmine milk tea was a bust. Drinkable but not great, especially compared to the made to order milk teas out there now-a-days. Glad I visited but would crave or make the effort to come back.
author: Nicole L.

description: Most fresh mango green tea I've ever had in my entire life. Such a cute little coffee shop around the corner too. Will be coming back a lot when I visit SF :)
author: Jan C.

description: Coconut honey tea...I don't think I need to say anything more; so delicious! Super cute new spot!
author: Olive L.

description: Ritual (R) coffee comes to Lone Mountain!  Small, spare, simple and good. Not a cafe like the Vélo Rouge. Almost Zen in its simplicity and planted like a zendo on a mundane corner of Geary and Spruce across from a car lot, Radio Shack, Lumber Liquidators and two Chinese real estate offices. No glamor.  Just great coffee. Who needs more?
author: Paul S.

description: Love. Adorable space. Amazing drinks. Fantastic donuts.
author: Katie C.

description: I highly recommend this cafe for coffee and tea and sweet treats. I had the honey coconut tea with tapioca and loved it. I am not usually a huge fan of boba tea, but this was great. Not too sweet and made with organic milk.  It's also has a great vibe; a great place to work or chat with friends.
author: Raj T.

description:
Great spot for coffee and (not your typical) donut. They carry Dynamo Donuts which have unique favor combos that really pop. Clean and simple coffeshop that serves products from local businesses, like their coffee is from Ritual, and same with their other pastries and chocolate (just forgot where from). Great friendly service. 

Two Quick Tips: 
1) don't let the address 3157 Geary Blvd fool you...it's a CORNER spot on Geary & Spruce. On the eastbound side of Geary, or in other words, going towards downtown. 
2) try the Hazelnut hot chocolate with an added espresso shot! YUM! I'm trying to get the Owner to call it "Arianna's Special". Let's see if it sticks :) PS, their espresso shots are doubles. Enjoy!
author: Margaret W.

description: If you are looking for perfect Crema, exceptional espresso, and consistency each time, go here for your cappuccino. The gluten-free donuts are out of this world.
author: andreas s.

description: Sonny and Vin are the sweetest and they certainly know their stuff.  I am a frequent customer who values their top quality product and attention to detail.  They buy organic and always cater to the needs of their customers.  I love their soy chais and drip coffees.  They recently added Asian-style crepes that they graciously customize.  I can not speak more highly of a neighborhood cafe than fifty/fity.  I am blessed to have them in my daily work week.
author: Natalie M.

description: I LOVE their bubble (boba) milk tea! I get the jasmine, honey coconut, and salted caramel.  BEST milk tea in town!  Also, the service is EXCELLENT and the staff their are super nice.  It's a small place, but nice if you are able to snag a table to do work.
author: Adele G.

description: Best coffee in the neighborhood. I am not a chai or milky tea drinker, but I've had them here and they are exceptional!
author: A S.

description:
Fifty/Fifty is my weekend ritual (pun fully intended). My family and I go here and have been loving this place since it opened. 

Now that I'm officially an SF coffee snob since I drink black coffee, it's great that they do proper pour overs (especially since no one else does in walking distance). They also have amazing pastries and other drinks that I never try because the coffee is so good. 

It's one of those places that makes up your neighborhood, without it things just wouldn't feel right.
author: Samir S.

description: Super mediocre, saw the barista making my iced latte, more than half the cup was espresso, way too strong for me! They didn't have the donuts, but the cookies looked pretty good. Not too cozy, but they have nice window seats.
author: Feed Her O.

description: This is a great place, always fast and polite service, very clean and minimal modern concept. Great latte- not crazy about the mocha. They have dynamo donuts fri-sun!
author: Matt Y.

description: A cute tiny TINY place. Super hipster and Asian at the same time.
author: Dominic C.

description: My friend and I love to try new coffee spots, we yelp a place and if we like it and its reviews are good, we check it out for ourselves, its a tradition we have always held dear to our hearts. We have been wanting to come here for a while and finally we had the opportunity. This place is the cutest little corner coffee shop I have ever seen, being in the outer Richmond district this place brings in a modern take to the neighborhood and its coffee. Before I start experimenting with coffee I always get a latte and a croissant, the traditional, the usual and the always way for me to know if a place has good coffee or bad coffee and or good or bad pastries. The latte I received was more than perfect, it was a perfect balance between milk and coffee, it was velvet smooth and they even topped it off with some foam art. I know you are thinking, this girl is weird she is taking about coffee as if it belongs in a museum of art, however shouldn't it? after all, it is what wakes america up in the morning, and why not know which coffee is good and which is bad.  The coffee here is good, you can make it any flavor you want with respect of course to the flavors they carry in store, you are able to create your own. Their pasties are good, the croissant I had was fluffy and crusty and soft all at the same time. My friend got green macha tea which was served in the old traditional Japanese way, cold and with milk. But it couldn't be more tasty, sweet, and smooth. She very much enjoyed it. Next time we come here we will be experimenting with more flavors and more pastries.
author: Svetlana T.

description: My favorite new coffee shop in the city. They're serious about their drinks here and take care to make each one. The menu may not be extensive but they serve all the essentials, latte, machiato,  americano, etc. I also love that they serve Ritual Coffee. Came by after lunch and ordered the pour over drip coffee, jasmine milk tea with boba and a dirty salted caramel milk tea with boba for $10.75. The boba drinks have a strong tea flavor and aren't masked by too much sweetness. The boba are nice and chewy. Also, make sure to get a stamp card if you plan on being a frequent customer!
author: Sarah L.

description: Very good coffee and quiet though a bit stark. But the bathroom was out of order the day I went last week.
author: K C.

description: I've not EVER had anything less than a super tasting Ritual coffee at Fifty / Fifty. Consistency is sublime and the customer service is fantastic - a world away from the snobbery at just about any Blue Bottle Coffee shops I've been to in SF. It's a great little place to think, get work done or meet a friend. This coffee snob is so full of gratitude :)
author: r d.

description: I depend on places like fifty/fifty to be able to focus and do work. I don't order anything special (black iced tea) but the environment is great. There isn't much seating, but I got lucky today.
author: Brian L.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood!  I live just a block away at Parker and Geary, and I've been wishing for a nice cafe to come and brighten up the neighborhood.  They usually have almond croissants in the mornings; buttery, flaky, and delicious!  (They didn't have it this morning, though).  The drip coffee is very good.  As for the decor, I do recommend that they put some artwork on the walls, to add some warmth to the place.  It's just my preference.  Right now, it feels a bit too minimalist with the blank white walls.
author: Warren L.

description: The coffee here is sooooo good! Heck, I'll even drink their Milk Teas, and I don't like tea, but their salted carmel one is just good. Highly recommend. Wish they had more seating and outdoor seating!
author: George K.

description: Cappuccino was great! The wifi was kind of spotty though.  So I couldn't work there and the music was being streamed, and was cutting in and out.  I think it was just a temporary problem.  Store's aesthetic was a little austere
author: Ken M.

description:
Great coffee shop that was desperately needed in this neighborhood. Standard coffee pricing for the city. Clean, modern atmosphere with good natural light. Owned by a very friendly couple. It's definitely a minimalist's menu, but by paring down the options they've been able to focus on making excellent pour-over coffee and espresso drinks with Ritual beans (which they also sell by the pound!). I haven't tried the milk teas yet, but the flavors look great. Great place to grab a coffee before work (the 38, 38L, and 38BX all stop here) or coffee and donut on the weekend.

Go elsewhere if you're looking for a mediocre coffee and breakfast bagel.
author: Anna X.

description: Fifty/Fifty is a great little coffee/tea shop. Wifi, great coffee, relaxing space, plugs, delicious baked goods from local bakeries, loose leaf tea... what more could you want?! They use Clover Organic milk, have a soy option, and you can also have Tapioca Milk Tea. What a great spot and lovely addition to the neighborhood.
author: Alyssa F.

description: Really tasty drink! Nice and quiet ambience. My friend and I both enjoy the service there!
author: Zhao M.

description: I popped in here in search of a tea latte on a work from home Friday and I'm soooo glad I did. This place is my new favorite neighborhood spot. Cute, modern, light decor and quiet music make for a great spot to get a drink and get some work or reading done. It's small though and I imagine there aren't a ton of seats on the weekend (I've only gone during the week). I had the salted caramel filled brioche donut and the honey coconut tea latte and both were life changing. Great service, and everything else looked delicious as well.
author: Amanda W.

description: This rating is entirely based on their Cappuccino, it is very good!! It seems to be very popular amongst coffee enthusiasts. Haven't had any of the food or other coffees that they serve.
author: Ethan H.

description: This coffee and tea shop is quite small inside. The staff were very mellow.
author: Forest T.

description: Beautiful, spare but warm aesthetic, lots of outlets and free wifi. What's not to love??
author: Aiko S.

description: Great new coffee and boba milk tea place in the Inner Richmond! Would go back again for sure! Love it! :-)
author: Hang N.

description: When I saw that the formerly empty space had opened with a new cafe, my first thought is, "why does this area need another cafe?  The market is saturated."  But after having visited it a couple of times, I think that this business has differentiated itself from the competition.  They have artisanal beverages such as single cup hand-pour with high-quality beans, gourmet loose teas, milk teas, and tea smoothies.  I especially liked the moroccan mint loose tea pot.  Also in contrast to most of the local cafes that are old, dingy and decrepit, everything at fifty/fifty is new.  The space has a clean modern look.  Even the coffee making appliances and the china are design-conscious.  They have obviously put some thought into their menu and are offering the neighborhood something different.
author: Robert B.

description: Ritual coffee, excellent teas. Just watch them make you a pour over coffee, it's magical.
author: Spencer P.

description: The cafe is small and quiet, but perfect place to get work done. I ordered the matcha milk tea without tapioca. It was milkier than I intended it to be, but I could still taste the matcha. The ice didn't water down my drink either. Overall, very refreshing. I would come back for it again. I also want to try its tea drinks next time.
author: Lucia Z.
